2021 20:14:08 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5e73e59dc485400c5d1ce534?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"50cb80e085c5a7bd461b3a8965176e48","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn49@2020_6/2021/04/10/03-45-53-569_b2a66008dd1452a0.webp","destWidth":1243,"destHeight":932,"sourceBytes":37598,"destBytes":37598,"author":"insider@insider.com (Abby Narishkin,Emmanuel Ocbazghi,Steve Cameron)","articleImgCdnMap":{"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn43@2020_5/2021/04/10/03-46-06-040_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aSNE2tV0N-4:jTA4-Pj1JLY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn8@2020_5/2021/04/10/03-46-33-760_004ac252569e30e6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aSNE2tV0N-4:jTA4-Pj1JLY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn11@2020_2/2021/04/10/03-46-07-772_e5f813460f06bab0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn75@2020_6/2021/04/10/03-46-00-486_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aSNE2tV0N-4:jTA4-Pj1JLY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn12@2020_4/2021/04/10/03-46-00-042_9c655e3bfcdc4b4c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/aSNE2tV0N-4":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn40@2020_5/2021/04/10/03-45-55-429_d69820c187ceb09d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1618026331640},{"createdTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","updatedTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","title":"DOJ veterans say the latest twist in the Matt Gaetz sex-trafficking investigation could be the most 'scary' one yet for the lawmaker","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/prosecutors-doj-veterans-react-joel-greenberg-plea-deal-matt-gaetz-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606c578ea7d803001963eea9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Matt Gaetz\" height=\"2736\" width=\"5472\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rep. Matt Gaetz.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li data-stringify-indent=\"0\"><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\">Rep. Gaetz is under pressure amid news that his associate Joel Greenberg is close to a plea deal.</strong></li>\n<li data-stringify-indent=\"0\"><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\">If Greenberg cooperates, that means someone Gaetz may have conspired with would be &#34;working with the government,&#34; said an ex-FBI agent.</strong></li>\n<li data-stringify-indent=\"0\"><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\">Greenberg could shed light on Gaetz&#39;s intent, which is crucial to building a case against him.</strong></li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Florida Rep. Matt Gaetz has been in hot water since The New York Times reported the existence of a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/matt-gaetz-sex-trafficking-extortion-investigation-explainer-timeline-2021-3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Justice Department investigation</a> into whether he had sex with a minor and broke federal sex-trafficking laws.</p><p>On Thursday, the pressure on Gaetz jumped another notch after lawyers representing Joel Greenberg, a former Florida tax collector who was indicted as part of the investigation, told a judge that Greenberg was close to accepting a plea deal.</p><p>It&#39;s a seismic development that could spell trouble for Gaetz, whose <a href=\"https://redirect.viglink.com/?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_161799841549112&key=0de604de366e10157cd309534403dfb2&libId=knaqemqm0101k4gd000DLidec1g70&loc=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.thedailybeast.com%2Fthe-strange-friendship-that-may-bring-down-matt-gaetz&v=1&out=https%3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2Fmattgaetz%2Fstatus%2F1067163992349712384&ref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.thedailybeast.com%2Fgaetz-paid-accused-sex-trafficker-who-then-venmod-teen&title=The%20Strange%20Friendship%20That%20May%20Bring%20Down%20Matt%20Gaetz&txt=called%20Greenberg%20his%20friendxt=called%20Greenberg%20his%20friend\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">friendship</a> with Greenberg <a href=\"https://redirect.viglink.com/?format=go&jsonp=vglnk_161799839919011&key=0de604de366e10157cd309534403dfb2&libId=knaqemqm0101k4gd000DLidec1g70&loc=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.thedailybeast.com%2Fthe-strange-friendship-that-may-bring-down-matt-gaetz&v=1&out=https%3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2FJoelGreenbergTC%2Fstatus%2F883868335955480576&ref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.thedailybeast.com%2Fgaetz-paid-accused-sex-trafficker-who-then-venmod-teen&title=The%20Strange%20Friendship%20That%20May%20Bring%20Down%20Matt%20Gaetz&txt=each%20shared%20a%20picture&#38;txt=each%20shared%20a%20picture\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">dates back to at least 2017</a>. Both men <a href=\"https://www.thedailybeast.com/the-strange-friendship-that-may-bring-down-matt-gaetz\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">grew up in wealthy Florida circles</a> and shared similar interests, and Greenberg <a href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/alexislevinson/matt-gaetz-ultimate-trump-defender-is-happy-being-notorious#.svYpMnN6x\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">told BuzzFeed News</a> in 2018 that he considered Gaetz a mentor.</p><p>It&#39;s unclear what the terms of his plea deal will be. An agreement hasn&#39;t been formalized, and the stipulations can vary from a defendant pleading guilty but refusing to divulge information about other targets to pleading guilty and agreeing to cooperate, which would get them additional leniency when sentencing approaches.</p><p>Either way, law-enforcement veterans said, it puts Gaetz in a highly unenviable position.</p><p>&#34;Doesn&#39;t bode well that his friend and alleged partner in crime just took a plea deal,&#34; said Jeffrey Cramer, a former federal prosecutor who spent 12 years at the Justice Department.</p><p>&#34;What Gaetz would be concerned about is if there&#39;s a cooperation agreement in this matter that involves the defendant flipping on him,&#34; said <a href=\"https://www.kroll.com/en/our-team/sherine-ebadi\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sherine Ebadi</a>, a former FBI agent who served as the lead agent in the government&#39;s case against ex-Trump campaign Chairman Paul Manafort. &#34;That gets scary for coconspirators because they know someone who&#39;s either aware of their crimes or someone they coconspired with is now working with the government.&#34;</p><p>Others echoed that assessment.</p><p>&#34;Simply put: As a prosecutor, you&#39;re not flipping Greenberg unless he gives you Gaetz,&#34; Elie Honig, a former federal prosecutor from the Southern District of New York, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/eliehonig/status/1380319065223409665\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">wrote</a>.</p><p>The Florida lawmaker has not been charged with any crimes, and he&#39;s <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/watch-tucker-carlson-matt-gaetz-interview-doj-sex-trafficking-video-2021-3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">fervently denied</a> the allegations against him, alleging the department&#39;s investigation is part of an <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/gaetz-tweets-response-doj-investigation-sex-trafficking-criminal-extortion-2021-3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">elaborate extortion scheme</a> targeting his family. A spokesperson for Gaetz did not immediately respond to a request for comment.</p><h2>Greenberg&#39;s attorney makes an unusual statement</h2><p>Greenberg&#39;s lawyer Fritz Scheller appeared to hint at a plea deal involving cooperation on Thursday, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/matt-gaetz-associate-joel-greenberg-lawyer-speaks-out-about-congressman-2021-4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">telling reporters after a court hearing</a>: &#34;I am sure Matt Gaetz is not feeling very comfortable today.&#34;</p><p>That said, it&#39;s unusual for prosecutors or defense attorneys to publicize the existence of a plea deal because they&#39;d want to avoid tipping off other targets.</p><p>&#34;It&#39;s certainly an interesting statement,&#34; Ebadi said of Scheller&#39;s comments. &#34;It makes you wonder what the motive was behind saying that.&#34;</p><p>She added that she&#39;d handled cases in which cooperators &#34;tried to work both sides&#34; because &#34;they know they have leverage against someone, and they want to try and broker some sort of deal to not cooperate.&#34;</p><p>&#34;I don&#39;t know if [Scheller&#39;s] foreshadowing, I don&#39;t know what the motive would be because generally cooperators don&#39;t want people to know they&#39;re cooperating,&#34; Ebadi said. &#34;But maybe that buck has passed because this case has been so publicly talked about.&#34;</p><p>When working with cooperating witnesses, prosecutors also take into account the person&#39;s credibility because &#34;now you&#39;re dealing with someone who already admitted to a crime and is motivated to tell you what you want to hear because it benefits them by potentially reducing their sentence,&#34; Ebadi said.</p><p>To vet the information they get, investigators dig for documents, financial records, and electronic filings to corroborate a cooperating witness&#39; testimony.</p><p>Former Justice Department officials said that this case, in particular, may not be a tough one to crack.</p><h2>Investigators have a huge pile of breadcrumbs to follow</h2><p>Gaetz is suspected of having had a sexual relationship with a woman when she was 17 years old in 2019. Investigators are also examining whether he paid for her to travel across state lines and broke sex-trafficking laws by doing so. The inquiry is looking into whether the Florida lawmaker used campaign money to fund travel for women, and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/matt-gaetz-investigation-looking-into-cash-paid-directly-women-nyt-2021-4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Times reported</a> investigators were scrutinizing Gaetz and Greenberg&#39;s interactions with &#34;multiple women who were recruited online for sex and received cash payments.&#34;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/matt-gaetz-bahamas-trip-federal-probe-sex-trafficking/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">CBS News reported</a> that prosecutors were also zeroing in on a trip Gaetz took to the Bahamas in late 2018 or early 2019 with a hand surgeon and marijuana entrepreneur who is accused of footing the bill for female sex workers, hotel rooms, and travel expenses. On Thursday, The Daily Beast reported that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/matt-gaetz-reportedly-sent-900-to-ally-accused-sex-trafficker-2021-4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Gaetz sent Greenberg $900 via Venmo</a> in 2018 and that Greenberg then sent $900, in varying amounts, to three young women.</p><p>&#34;The problem for the congressman is that anything involving travel with others always leaves behind a trail of documents and records,&#34; Cramer said. &#34;If he did travel with an underage girl while in a sexual relationship with her, records exist proving that.&#34;</p><p>The woman Gaetz is suspected of having a sexual relationship with would be 19 years old now and may also be willing to talk to investigators, he added.</p><h2>What Greenberg could tell prosecutors</h2><p>Then there&#39;s other information prosecutors would need to build a strong case, details they may not be able to glean from records and documents. That&#39;s where Greenberg comes in.</p><p>For one, he could have been privy to conversations in which only he and Gaetz were present or private communications that took place on encrypted apps, in text messages that could have been deleted, or on a burner phone.</p><p>&#34;There could be a number of things they did that the government may not have access to or doesn&#39;t even know exist,&#34; Ebadi said.</p><p>But the biggest thing he could speak to, she added, is whether Gaetz expressed his intent in the conduct he&#39;s accused of engaging in.</p><p>&#34;Depending on what prosecutors charge, often an element in various cases is intent, or proving someone&#39;s knowledge or willfulness when committing a crime,&#34; Ebadi said, adding that with Greenberg, &#34;you could have someone that was present when [Gaetz] was making statements like, &#39;I&#39;m going to do this,&#39; or &#39;I&#39;m doing this for these particular reasons.&#39; Those are crucial words in a case like this, especially when it comes to that element of intent.&#34;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 11:45:31","updatedTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","title":"A guide to Bixby Home, the hub where you can access Samsung’s digital voice assistant","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-bixby-home","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606e33d670954f0019195cae?format=jpeg\" alt=\"bixby\" height=\"2127\" width=\"4254\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bixby Home is the landing page for the voice assistant, and it can be accessed in a few different ways.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Drew Angerer/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li aria-level=\"1\">Bixby Home is a landing page for Bixby commands and tutorials found on any Samsung device that includes the Bixby voice assistant. </li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">You can start Bixby Home by pressing the Bixby button (or the side or Power button, depending on your device).  </li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">At one time, Bixby Home was highly customizable, but Samsung has greatly simplified the page.</li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\">Visit Insider&#39;s Tech Reference library for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Bixby is the voice assistant for Samsung devices, similar to Siri on Apple devices and Alexa on Amazon products.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"related-article-module\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"606dfbb4badeb411dd761fac\" data-title=\"What is Bixby? A guide to Samsung's digital voice assistanttant\" data-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bixby\" data-thumbnail=\"https://i.insider.com/undefined\">Related Article Module: What is Bixby? A guide to Samsung&#39;s digital voice assistant</bi-shortcode><p>If you have a Samsung phone or tablet, you have a choice of voice assistants because it also includes Google Assistant. </p><h2>What to know about Bixby Home</h2><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bixby\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">There are several ways to access Bixby</a>. You can summon the service by saying &#34;Hi, Bixby,&#34; or you can open the Bixby Home page. Bixby Home gives you access to many common Bixby commands and offers tips, tutorials, and advice for getting the most out of Bixby. </p><h2>How to open Bixby Home</h2><p>You can open Bixby Home by pressing the Bixby or side button, depending which button your Samsung device includes. Both buttons are located on the side of the device under the volume control, but each works slightly differently by default: To open Bixby Home using the Bixby button, press the button once. To open Bixby Home with the side button, double-press the button. You can also reconfigure these options; see <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bixby\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">our guide to Bixby</a> for details.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606e385170954f0019195cb2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"What is Bixby Home 1\" height=\"3040\" width=\"1440\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bixby Home can be opened by pressing the Bixby or side button on your Samsung phone.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Recently, Samsung has reduced the importance of the Bixby Home page and generally the only way to reach it is via one of these buttons. If you have an older device, though, you might be able to open the Bixby Home page by swiping to the left from your device&#39;s Home page. Here&#39;s how to turn Bixby Home on or off:</p><p><strong>1. </strong>Tap and hold any blank part of the home screen. </p><p><strong>2. </strong>Swipe to the right until you see the Bixby Home page. If the page to the left of home is Samsung Free, it has replaced Bixby Home and isn&#39;t available on your device. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606e392f30004b0019b268f2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"What is Bixby Home 2\" height=\"3040\" width=\"1440\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tap and hold to see the customization screen for your Samsung home page.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>3. </strong>Slide the switch at the top right of the screen to turn Bixby Home on or off. </p><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><h2><strong>How to customize Bixby Home</strong></h2><p>At one time, Bixby Home featured the ability to customize the screen by adding and rearranging cards on the screen. Samsung has since simplified the Bixby Home screen. Here&#39;s how to get around the page:</p><ul><li aria-level=\"1\">The toolbar at the bottom of the screen gives you access to Type to Bixby, Bixby Voice, and a home button that returns you to the top of Bixby Home. </li><li aria-level=\"1\">Tap the menu button (three lines at the top left of the screen) to see your available options. You can see quick commands, open Bixby settings, and get access to Bixby tutorials. </li><li aria-level=\"1\">Scroll through the Bixby Home page for tips, tricks, and curated commands to explore Bixby. You can start any of these Bixby commands by tapping the appropriate button or using the Bixby wake word and asking Bixby to run it (such as, &#34;Hi, Bixby, start a timer for 10 minutes.&#34;)<br><br></li></ul><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606e397530004b0019b268f3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"What is Bixby Home 3\" height=\"3040\" width=\"1440\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Bixby Home screen has commands and tutorials for Bixby, and there are additional tools in the Bixby Home menu.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></aside><bi-shortcode id=\"related-article-module-end-of-article\" class=\"mceNonEditable\"><a data-type=\"606dfbb4badeb411dd761fac\" data-title=\"What is Bixby? A guide to Samsung's digital voice assistanttant\" data-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bixby\" data-vertical=\"sai\" data-image=\"https://i.insider.com/606e17f370954f0019195c37\">What is Bixby? A guide to Samsung&#39;s digital voice assistant</a><a data-type=\"5faede422b29982926084be7\" data-title=\"A full list of Google voice commands you can use with Google Assistant to make everyday tasks easier\" data-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/google-voice-commands\" data-vertical=\"sai\" data-image=\"https://i.insider.com/5faee4da402d49001924ee51\">A full list of Google voice commands you can use with Google Assistant to make everyday tasks easier</a><a data-type=\"5ffddea6db505f4bf301f17b\" data-title=\"How to translate live conversations with Google Assistant using its built-in Interpreter Mode\" data-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-translate-conversations-with-google-assistant\" data-vertical=\"sai\" data-image=\"https://i.insider.com/5ffde548f3df630018cc162e\">How to translate live conversations with Google Assistant using its built-in Interpreter Mode</a><a data-type=\"5faed7851e1b355c7e071276\" data-title=\"A comprehensive list of Siri voice commands you can use on an iPhone\" data-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/siri-voice-commands\" data-vertical=\"sai\" article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-bixby-home'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=98cx6s3AlJA:uyqKHScndGQ:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=98cx6s3AlJA:uyqKHScndGQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=98cx6s3AlJA:uyqKHScndGQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" 11:45:31","updatedTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","title":"Sidney Powell quotes Buzz Lightyear in response to sanctions request for her election conspiracy-theory lawsuit","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/sidney-powell-cites-toy-story-legal-filing-against-sanctions-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6070ad47a451820019b3a5c6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sidney powell buzz lightyear\" height=\"2250\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Sidney Powell and Buzz Lightyear.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tom Williams/CQ-Roll Call, Inc via Getty Images; Disney-Pixar</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Sidney Powell asked a judge to turn down a motion for sanctions against her in Wisconsin.</li>\n<li>She made the argument on a technicality and quoted &#34;Toy Story&#34; in her legal filing.</li>\n<li>Powell pushed lawsuits based on conspiracy theories in a failed attempt to overturn the election.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The conspiracy theorist and former Trump attorney Sidney Powell said a judge should dismiss Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers&#39; filing for sanctions against her, arguing he waited too long and using a quote from &#34;Toy Story&#34; to bolster her case.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.wied.92717/gov.uscourts.wied.92717.106.0.pdf\">Powell&#39;s motion</a>, filed Thursday, is a response to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/wisconsin-gov-evers-court-sanction-trump-powell-election-lawsuits-2021-4\">the Democratic governor&#39;s request in March</a> to have Powell and her associates pay $106,000 to cover legal fees over her failed lawsuit to throw out presidential-election votes in his state.</p><p>Powell fought the sanctions request on procedural grounds.</p><p>&#34;Defendant would have this Court make new law, create an exception for a baseless and untimely motion, which - with no precedent in the case law or any rule - could extend the time for filing a sanctions motion &#39;to infinity and beyond&#39; to harass a plaintiff in what amounts to nothing more than political grandstanding,&#34; she wrote in the legal motion.</p><p>The sentence included a footnote that said &#34;Buzz Lightyear, Toy Story (Pixar 1995).&#34;</p><p>Her lawsuit was part of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-lawsuits-election-results-2020-11\">a group of failed lawsuits</a> she nicknamed the &#34;Kraken,&#34; which sought to overturn 2020 election results in states that President Donald Trump lost. They were premised on false conspiracy theories that held Dominion and Smartmatic, two unrelated election-technology companies, were secretly in cahoots with each other through the machinations of Hugo Chávez, a dead Venezuelan president, to flip results from Trump to now-President Joe Biden.</p><p>Before filing those lawsuits on her own, Powell was a member of Trump&#39;s election-litigation team, which <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-lawsuits-election-results-2020-11\">also failed</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-purges-conspiracy-theorist-attorney-sidney-powell-2020-11\">which she was fired from</a>.</p><p>Numerous independent commissions, audits, and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-lawsuits-election-results-2020-11\">judicial decisions</a> have shown that the 2020 election results were not marred by widespread voter fraud, as Trump and Powell alleged.</p><p>&#34;Instead of evidence and legal argument, Plaintiff offered a tangled web of irrelevant (and inaccurate) conspiracy theories, ultimately suggesting that Dominion voting machines had altered individual votes to favor Joseph R. Biden, Jr.,&#34; <a href=\"https://www.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.wied.92717/gov.uscourts.wied.92717.98.0.pdf\">attorneys for Evers wrote in March</a>. &#34;Plaintiff advanced this conspiracy theory without factual support and, worse still, deliberately ignored definitive proof disproving his allegations.&#34; </p><p>The motion from Evers also targeted Trump&#39;s attorneys for their lawsuits, seeking $144,000 in sanctions, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/wisconsin-gov-evers-court-sanction-trump-powell-election-lawsuits-2021-4\">Insider&#39;s Kelly McLaughlin previously reported</a>.</p><p>Additionally, Powell is <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/sydney-powell-defense-in-dominion-lawsuit-used-against-her-michigan-2021-4\">facing sanctions in Michigan</a>, where she filed another &#34;Kraken&#34; lawsuit. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/michigan-dems-disbar-pro-trump-lawyers-sidney-powell-lin-wood-2021-1\">The city of Detroit is seeking to have her disbarred in the state</a>.</p><p>Legal-ethics experts <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/could-sidney-powell-be-disbarred-for-election-lawsuits-conspiracy-theories-2020-12\">previously told Insider</a> Powell could warrant sanctions for including plaintiffs who didn&#39;t appear to agree to be part of her lawsuits and for appearing to manipulate evidence included in them.</p><p>She is <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/everyone-dominion-smartmatic-suing-defamation-election-conspiracy-theories-2021-2\">also the target of separate defamation lawsuits from Dominion and Smartmatic</a>, which are collectively seeking billions of dollars in damages for her baseless allegations.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 11:45:31","updatedTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","title":"Travel restrictions are constantly changing, so Expedia has created a tool that can help identify where you can go","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/expedia-travel-covid-restrictions-tool-travelers-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606f13a530004b0019b26a04?format=jpeg\" alt=\"expedia\" height=\"1250\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A screenshot of Expedia&#39;s COVID-19 travel advisor page.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.expedia.com/lp/b/travel-advisor\" target=\"_blank\">Expedia</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Expedia partnered with Sherpa to create a tool that shows travel restrictions in different countries.</li>\n<li>These restrictions can range from quarantining, to COVID-19 testing, to face mask mandates.</li>\n<li>International travel has been seeing an uptick again as vaccine rollout continues.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>International travel is beginning to see an <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/why-americans-have-been-escaping-to-mexico-during-the-pandemic-2021-2\">uptick</a> again as vaccine rollout continues around the world. However, restrictions are constantly changing, which can put soon-to-be travelers in a difficult planning position leading up to their dream post-covid vacation.</p><p>For those interested in international travel but unsure of different restrictions, Expedia has partnered with Sherpa - a travel tech company that&#39;s previously worked with businesses like American Airlines - to create a tool. Expedia has officially rolled out its &#34;<a href=\"https://www.expedia.com/lp/b/travel-advisor\">COVID-19 travel advisor</a>,&#34; a compilation of restrictions, quarantine policies, COVID-19 testing mandates, and necessary health documents needed to travel to different countries. </p><p>Using the new tool is easy. All users have to do is enter their origin country, destination, and date of travel. From there, the webpage will populate with all the information travelers will need to know before embarking on an international vacation, and what they&#39;ll need to have on hand in order to re-enter their home country.</p><p>According to Stacey Symonds, a senior director of experience insights with Expedia Group, the program aims to &#34;reduce friction for travelers.&#34;</p><p>&#34;Right now, many people are considering booking trips as the COVID-19 vaccine rollout continues, but at the same time, they&#39;re inundated with conflicting information about where and how they can safely travel,&#34; Symonds said in the <a href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210408005253/en\">press release</a>.</p><p>Over 1.6 million people have used Expedia&#39;s tool since its pilot phase began in November 2020. And according to <a href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210408005253/en\">Expedia</a>, 25% more travelers, compared to pre-COVID-19 numbers, have been using online travel agencies to plan their trips.</p><p>The new travel advisor program has also been rolled out across Expedia Groups&#39; different brands, including Hotels.com, Orbitz, Travelocity, and Vrbo.</p><div src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cabeb65c6cc505d5a3d4964?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tiger Woods\" height=\"682\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Andrew Redington/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>We ranked the top 30 golfers of all time based on career earnings on the PGA Tour and European Tour combined.</li><li>Not surprisingly, Tiger Woods is at the top and it is not even close.</li><li>There are a lot of names that would likely surprise most fans, even near the top of the list.</li><li><span><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Visit BusinessInsider.com for more stories</a>. </span></li></ul><p><span>Professional golfers can have careers that are highly lucrative.</span></p><p>Their careers can last well into their 40s and 50s and there are events nearly year-round with tours all over the world. That means lots of opportunities to take home a paycheck.</p><p>Below, we take a look at the 30 highest-paid golfers of all time. The list is skewed towards recent players, but there is a mix of both current and previous generations, as well as both PGA Tour and European Tour greats. </p><p><em>Both PGA Tour and European Tour earnings include winnings from majors and WGC events. However, those events are only counted once in each golfer&#39;s total earnings.</em></p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\t30. K.J. Choi - $34.4 million (€30.3 million)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cabeaccc6cc50575a3d0864?format=jpeg\" alt=\"K.J. Choi\" height=\"683\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kai Schwoerer/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Nationality:</strong> South Korea</p><p><strong>PGA Tour earnings:</strong>&#160;$32.7 million</p><p><strong>European Tour earnings:&#160; </strong>&#8364;5.6 million</p><p><strong>Major championships:</strong> 0</p><p><strong>Overall wins:</strong> 9</p>\n\t29. 11:45:31","updatedTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","title":"The 6 best hammocks for backyards and camping","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-hammock","description":"<ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><strong>Hammocks are a relaxing way to rest in your backyard, at a campsite, or in the backcountry.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>Factors in buying a hammock include tree access, outdoorsy features, and insect protection. </strong></li>\n<li><strong>Our top pick, the <a href=\"https://amzn.to/2YZ9Vfh\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Wildhorn Outfitters Outpost</a>, lets you lay flat and only costs $40. </strong></li>\n</ul><p>Hammocks have been used for literally hundreds of years, dating back to early indigenous Americans. They&#39;re incredibly practical, lifting you off the ground to stay cool in the heat of summer and protected from insects or, in the backcountry, wildlife.</p><p>In the modern era, hammocks are often seen swinging in <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-places-buy-outdoor-patio-furniture-online\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">backyards</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/camping-essentials-list\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">campsites</a>, frat houses, and teenagers&#39; bedrooms. They&#39;re prized for their comfort and for how easily they fold up for transport and storage when the R&#38;R session is over.</p><p>Each hammock on our list shares a couple of key characteristics in that they hang from two fixed points (not always a tree) and support a person or two. However, that&#39;s where the comparisons stop. Some hammocks are designed for comfort, others for light travel and to withstand the elements outside. Before you buy a hammok, it&#39;s important to think through where you&#39;ll use it, how you&#39;ll set it up, and who might be sharing or borrowing it, which we go into in more detail at the end of this guide.</p><p>In the meantime, we&#39;ve personally tested the majority of the hammocks on this list and can confirm - your life can only get better after a nap in any hammock on this list.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents-sticky\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Masthead Sticky</bi-shortcode><h3>Here are our picks of the best hammocks:</h3><ul overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/59d4f6c5c68d7b6d1e8b7192?format=jpeg\" alt=\"wildhorn outfitters\" height=\"999\" width=\"1332\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Wildhorn Outfitters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Outpost-Double-Single-Camping-Hammock/dp/B011W0VEOC/?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_100417_best-hammocks-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=e2a9c00a032d12f5287eafccc313413b&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Wildhorn Outfitters Outpost Camping Hammock</a> measures 11-feet long, so you can achieve an almost flat sleeping position when spread out on a diagonal.&#160;</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Long hammock for ideal sleeping comfort, easy to set up and adjust strap system, high-quality materials</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Slightly bulky when packed, not made with ripstop fabric</p><p>Most hammocks feel great when you first climb in, your body feeling almost weightless as you ease yourself into a gentle curve and rock back and forth in the breeze. But when you're ready to shift out of that initial position, you're basically out of luck. That's because many hammocks are only comfortably enjoyed on your back and in near-total (but blissful) stillness.</p><p>With the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Outpost-Double-Single-Camping-Hammock/dp/B011W0VEOC/?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_100417_best-hammocks-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=e2a9c00a032d12f5287eafccc313413b&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Wildhorn Outfitters Outpost hammock</a>, you have the room and support you need to shift positions and move about as you search for that ideal arrangement of your body's various parts. The 11-foot span of the Outpost allows you to stretch out fully, with room to spare for most people, and creates a nearly flat space when you lie in it diagonally &#8212; provided you're able to secure the ends of the hammock tautly and far enough apart.</p><p>At 1 lb 10 oz, this isn't the lightest parachute nylon hammock, but it's still light and compact enough for use on overland treks or during climbs. The generous size and comfort of the hammock more than compensate for those few extra ounces. Speaking of ounces, the hammock is tested to support up to 1,000 pounds, though its safety rated at a maximum of 400 pounds.</p><p><strong>Read our full review of the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hummingbird-hammocks-ultralight-single-hammock-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">Wildhorn Outfitters Outpost hammock</a>.</strong></p>\n\tThe best low-cost hammock\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/59d269dcc68d7b282e8b6097?format=jpeg\" alt=\"newdora hammock\" height=\"750\" width=\"1000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Newdora</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Newdora-Ultralight-Multifunctional-Lightweight-Backpacking/dp/B01J7BPZLQ/?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_100417_best-hammocks-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=0006f46569e44714141a449eb1a136aa&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Newdora Parachute Cloth Ultralight Hammock</a> weighs just 17 ounces, supports up to 600 pounds, and costs less than $30.</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Very low cost, large weight capacity, lightweight and compact</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Inferior rope included with hammock, no setup instructions</p><p>There are a lot of positive attributes worth noting about the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Newdora-Ultralight-Multifunctional-Lightweight-Backpacking/dp/B01J7BPZLQ/?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_100417_best-hammocks-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=0006f46569e44714141a449eb1a136aa&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Newdora Parachute Cloth Ultralight Hammock</a>, but let's get right to the point: This hammock costs less than dinner at a casual dining restaurant. It's less than $20 (a bit more if you want the mosquito net) yet in terms of design and material quality, it's far from cheaply made.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Newdora-Ultralight-Multifunctional-Lightweight-Backpacking/dp/B01J7BPZLQ/?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_100417_best-hammocks-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=0006f46569e44714141a449eb1a136aa&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Newdora Ultralight hammock</a> is perfect for the hiker or climber who needs a place to snooze while taking a break from the adventure. It quickly sets up and is just as easy to take down and pack away, minimizing the time you spend making or breaking camp. At just over 1 pound, it doesn't add notable gear weight, so you can bring one along even if you'll spend the nights in a tent and sleeping bag and just want a spot to relax.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Newdora-Ultralight-Multifunctional-Lightweight-Backpacking/dp/B01J7BPZLQ/?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_100417_best-hammocks-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=0006f46569e44714141a449eb1a136aa&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Newdora Ultralight</a> measures 8.75 ft long and 5.4 ft wide. Given those dimensions and its excellent weight capacity, two adults can share it for some cozy relaxation. If you're going to sleep in this hammock, though, we recommend doing it solo. The attached stuff sack doubles as a handy pocket while the hammock is set up, giving you a spot for a headlamp, phone, snack, and so forth. Speaking of setup, that part is easy thanks to the included tree ropes and steel carabiners.</p>\n\tThe best backyard hammock\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/59d26abd351ccf89468b62c9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best choice hammock\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Best Choice</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>Thanks to the included stand, you can set up the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Best-Choice-Products-Portable-Carrying/dp/B00LOZNXRC/?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_100417_best-hammocks-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=0b39be8216a42f2486c468f22c806056&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Best Choice Products Cotton Double Hammock</a> anywhere, no trees required.</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Sets up anywhere, lightweight hammock and stand, all-season comfort</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Not actually large enough for two adults, expensive, prone to tipping over with vigorous swinging</p><p>As the name suggests, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Best-Choice-Products-Portable-Carrying/dp/B00LOZNXRC/?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_100417_best-hammocks-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=0b39be8216a42f2486c468f22c806056&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Best Choice Products Cotton Double Hammock</a> is made from soft, woven cotton. You sink into the material, enjoying comfort and support ideal for an <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/are-naps-good-for-you\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">afternoon nap</a>, a break from the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-gardening-tools\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">yard work</a>, or while disappearing into the pages of a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-summer-beach-reads-books-for-vacation\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">great book</a>. Add a blanket and this hammock keeps you warm and cozy in colder weather. It's a good choice for summertime, too, as the breeze drifts over your stretched-out body.</p><p>Perhaps the best part about this hammock is that it comes with a modular steel stand. The stand can be assembled (or disassembled) in a matter of minutes and both the stand segments and the hammock tuck away into a carrying case.</p><p>That means you can set up this <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Best-Choice-Products-Portable-Carrying/dp/B00LOZNXRC/?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_100417_best-hammocks-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=0b39be8216a42f2486c468f22c806056&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Best Choice Products Cotton Double Hammock</a> in the yard, on the porch, at a campsite, at a tailgating party, or anywhere else you want &#8212; no trees, fence posts, or wall anchors required. As the stand is resin-coated to be weather resistant, you can also set it up in a permanent location.</p><p>Oh, and we also love the multiple color and pattern options.&#160;</p>\n\tThe best hammock for backpacking\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d435293100a240bb521cd65?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Hummingbird Hammock\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hummingbird Hammocks</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>Weighing just 7 ounces, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Pawleys-Island-Hammocks-Original-Hammock/dp/B000068DY9/?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_100417_best-hammocks-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=07af2ce985d64c337ca4327b6957c64f&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Hummingbird Ultralight Single Hammock</a> folds down to fit inside a pocket or bag.</h3><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Easy to set up, comfortable, durable, lightweight, compact</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Pricier than similar hammocks</p><p>Several of our recommended products are ideal for backpacking but when you're shedding as much weight as you can, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Pawleys-Island-Hammocks-Original-Hammock/dp/B000068DY9/?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_100417_best-hammocks-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=07af2ce985d64c337ca4327b6957c64f&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Hummingbird Ultralight Single Hammock</a> is the best choice. It's comparable to our overall pick in many ways but at $65, it's pricey, which is why it didn't nab the top spot. However, you can't deny the lightweight and its military-grade build quality makes it very durable.</p><p>When we <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hummingbird-hammocks-ultralight-single-hammock-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">reviewed the hammock</a>, our writer found it \"much easier to carry than a bulky folding chair,\" considering that it folds into a bag that's smaller than the size of your palm. The size and weight are important if you're doing a multiday backpacking trip.</p><p>Another consideration for using a hammock when backpacking: Due to the way it cradles the body, sleeping in a hammock is better for your spine than lying on rocky ground. Of course, a tent offers protection from the elements but when the opportunity allows, give a hammock a try.</p><p>Overall, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Pawleys-Island-Hammocks-Original-Hammock/dp/B000068DY9/?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_100417_best-hammocks-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=07af2ce985d64c337ca4327b6957c64f&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Hummingbird Ultralight Single Hammock</a> is easy to set up. It supports a weight limit of 350 pounds, and there is an extra-long version of the hammock for taller folks (it adds 3 ounces to the overall weight) and a double version to fit two people (max weight is 300 pounds). And, the company offers a lifetime warranty. <em>&#8212; Les Shu</em></p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hummingbird-hammocks-ultralight-single-hammock-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full review of the Hummingbird Ultralight Single Hammock.</a></p>\n\tThe best hammock for camping\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6070dc434943790018bb1c5b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"kammock roo double_final\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kammok</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>Whether you want to hammock camp or just lounge at the campsite, the <a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;mi=10248&#38;pw=184534&#38;ctc=&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F149550%2Fkammok-roo-double-hammock\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Kammok Roo Double</a> packs down small for easy transport and is water-resistant, durable, easy to set up, and comfortable for two people.</h3><p><strong>Pros</strong>: Lightweight, water-resistant, packs down small, comes with lifetime warranty, fits two people comfortably</p><p><strong>Cons</strong>: Hanging straps not included, expensive, a bit heavy for backpacking (18 oz)</p><p>Whether you want an angelic way to nap after a long, hot hike or to forgo your tent and hammock camp, you want a hammock that won't retain heat and can stand up to the elements.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;mi=10248&#38;pw=184534&#38;ctc=&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F149550%2Fkammok-roo-double-hammock\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Kammok Roo Double</a> is slightly pricier than others on our list, but the durability and small details make it well-worth the investment.</p><p>It's constructed with uber-strong proprietary ripstop nylon &#8212; ideal to hold up against all the wear-and-tear of many, many camping trips. The fabric is soft out of the box and treated with DWR water repellency, which means it'll keep you cool on humid days and dry through lightly wet nights.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;mi=10248&#38;pw=184534&#38;ctc=&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F149550%2Fkammok-roo-double-hammock\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Roo Double hammock</a> is only 18 ounces, but can comfortably fit two people or one person and a dog (that ripstop nylon is also great against dog claws) with a 500-pound weight capacity. It's also crafted with lot of thoughtful details, like fade-resistant treatment on the brightly-colored fabric and soft seams on the side so you can comfortably hang your legs off.</p><p>You can secure the hammock around basically any tree or pole with Kammok's <a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;mi=10248&#38;pw=184534&#38;ctc=&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F132595%2Fkammok-python-10-hammock-straps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">10-foot Python straps</a>, which have 20 daisy chain loops that make it easy to latch the hammock's durable carabiners to, no matter the width of the tree.&#160;</p><p>The only downside is the Python straps aren't included and will cost you <a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;mi=10248&#38;pw=184534&#38;ctc=&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F132595%2Fkammok-python-10-hammock-straps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">an extra $30</a>. Plus, the straps and the hammock itself live in two separate bags so you have to take care to make sure you have both before you leave for your trip (I've made that mistake once or twice).</p><p>Note that if you want to save weight and money, Kammok also makes the <a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;mi=10248&#38;pw=184534&#38;ctc=&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F130005%2Fkammok-roo-single-hammock\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Roo Single</a> for one person (10 ounces, $70). But the <a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;mi=10248&#38;pw=184534&#38;ctc=&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F149550%2Fkammok-roo-double-hammock\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Double</a> is only $10 more, roomy to sleep in solo, and allows for versatility on future trips with friends or pets. <em>-- Rachael Schultz</em></p>\n\tThe best classic rope hammock\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/59d26956c68d7b1d008b6685?format=jpeg\" alt=\"hammock\" height=\"1125\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hammock Source</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>For idling away the hours of a summer afternoon, there's nothing like a classic woven rope hammock like the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Pawleys-Island-Hammocks-Original-Hammock/dp/B000068DY9/?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_100417_best-hammocks-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=07af2ce985d64c337ca4327b6957c64f&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Pawleys Island Original hammock</a>.</h3><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Classic style, large enough for two adults, weather-resistant components</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Additional hardware needed for setup, rather expensive</p><p>The name of this hammock comes from Pawleys Island, South Carolina, where hammocks were first mass-produced in the United States back in the late 19th century. Not much differs between this hammock and the ones produced more than 125 years ago, too.</p><p>It features a double-woven bed made from more than 1,000 feet of braided cotton rope, solid oak spreader bars, and steel hardware. It has a few modern updates, too. The steel is zinc-plated to help it resist corrosion and the oak bars are dipped in a marine spar varnish to enhance their weather resistance.</p><p>This classic rope hammock is at its best when one or two people are lying on their backs and doing nothing at all, though reading a book and/or <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/easy-alcoholic-drinks-to-make-at-home\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">sipping a cocktail</a> or glass of lemonade are also acceptable.</p><p>This style of hammock tends to be hard to get in and out of, and others might find the rope less comfortable than a solid weave or parachute fabric. But the nostalgia is real.</p><p>The open rope design is inarguably ideal for a hot day as it promotes excellent airflow. This hammock belongs strung up between two elm trees in a suburban backyard or between two palms on the beach. Mine currently resides in the yard of its third residence, the hammock having moved around Southern California and then clear across the country with me.</p>\n\tThe best hammock for insect protection\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/59d26b4cc68d7b1c008b66e0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"g4free hammock\" height=\"751\" width=\"1001\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">G4Free</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><strong>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/G4Free-Portable-Mosquito-Capacity-Foldable/dp/B01F58BAGO/?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_100417_best-hammocks-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=872282861fb5c1e03025830e32549ec0&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">G4Free Portable Hammock with Mosquito Net</a> creates a safe, insect-free shelter, keeping you protected from the nuisance and the <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/signs-a-bug-bite-is-serious-2018-7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">real dangers of bug bites</a>.</strong></h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Protects the user against insects, versatile design, low price point</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Not comfortable enough for multi-day use, netting rips easily</p><p>Bug bites and bee stings are up near the top of the list of things that are no fun. While most insect bites are merely annoying, causing an itch or a bit of pain, mosquito-borne illnesses like the Zika virus, dengue fever, malaria, and more can be <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/signs-a-bug-bite-is-serious-2018-7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">serious, even deadly, issues</a>.</p><p>Whether you're traveling to an area known for endemic insect-borne diseases or you're just tired of having flies buzzing around you while you try to relax, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/G4Free-Portable-Mosquito-Capacity-Foldable/dp/B01F58BAGO/?&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_100417_best-hammocks-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=872282861fb5c1e03025830e32549ec0&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">G4Free Portable Hammock with Mosquito Net</a> is a great solution.</p><p>The hammock itself is made from smooth, supportive parachute-style nylon and generously accommodates a single adult user. Two hoop-shaped wireframes hold the insect netting up and out of the way, creating a large interior area in which you can sit up and move about without constantly touching the mesh. The netting can also be detached and moved out of the way when not needed.</p><p>The materials used to construct the hammock, mesh, and the supporting roping are all mildew and rot-resistant, making this insect shelter hammock a great choice for use in jungles, on beaches, and in various tropical locations. Your back might protest after multiple nights of sleeping in it, though, as it does dip noticeably when in use.</p>\n\tWhat to look for when buying a hammock\n\t\n\t<p>Hammocks are amazing for any leisurely outdoor experience, whether in the backyard or backcountry. But what you want in one is entirely different for those two situations.</p><p>We tested models from some of the most well-respected hammock makers in the industry for all types of lounging experiences. But there are a few key things to consider before deciding which to buy:</p><p>First, <strong>who</strong> will be using the hammock? Every hammock has a weight capacity and size capacity, so consider the size of the single person, or if you'll want to lay in it with your sweetie, regularly.&#160;</p><p><strong>When</strong> will you use your new hammock? This issue is a bit more nuanced than you might think. Sure, saying \"I'll probably use it on Saturday afternoons\" might be the right answer, but you should also consider the season (temperature and insects can be factors in choosing) and if you will be using the hammock overnight.</p><p><strong>Where</strong> you install the hammock &#8212; will you use it camping in the wilderness or only on the patio beside the pool? Is it going to be hung in the basement playroom or in a bedroom? Will you want to set up and take down the hammock frequently and in various locations, or leave it as a semi-permanent installation? Not only do these allow you to select the right hammock but make sure you're getting the most out of which one you ultimately decide on.&#160;</p><p>Finally, <strong>how</strong> will you use your hammock? Is this purely a leisure investment or if you want to get into hammock camping. The latter you can also use in your backyard, but you can't take, say, a rope hammock to a National Park and expect to get a good night's sleep in it.&#160;Many are designed for specific use cases and using them improperly can significantly impact the experience.&#160;</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a dn51@2020_5/2021/04/10/03-46-04-188_77c1207cb6c324e1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/wgRl3EA9m0E":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn20@2020_6/2021/04/10/03-46-07-807_2f393fb680f438f5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1618026331649},{"createdTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","updatedTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","title":"Rep. Katie Porter calls Biden's move to split up his infrastructure package 'a big mistake'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/katie-porter-infrastructure-biden-plan-congress-big-mistake-women-family-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f75348f74fe5b0018a8e691?format=jpeg\" alt=\"katie porter\" height=\"2190\" width=\"4381\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Representative Katie Porter (D-CA).\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brian Snyder/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Rep. Katie Porter of California called Biden&#39;s move to split his infrastructure plan &#39;a big mistake.&#39;</li>\n<li>She argued Democrats should merge family policies into a large infrastructure plan.</li>\n<li>Last month, Biden noted that 2 millions women had left the workforce since the pandemic started.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Democratic Rep. Katie Porter of California called President Joe Biden&#39;s decision to split up his infrastructure plan into separate jobs and family components a major error.</p><p>&#34;This idea that there are two separate buckets, a bucket of American Jobs Plan ... and this idea he has a second plan coming soon that he&#39;s called the American Families Plan. I told the White House, &#39;I think this is a big mistake,&#39;&#34; she said in <a href=\"https://www.axios.com/katie-porter-infrastructure-biden-d6f26e23-c3ce-4b8f-85f2-3c0f3b81579e.html?utm_campaign=organic&utm_medium=socialshare&utm_source=twitter=twitter\">an Axios interview published Friday.</a></p><p>She continued: &#34;I think it&#39;s mislabeling what you know as president to be true, which is that all of this is about our economy and economic recovery.&#34;</p><p>&#34;Strong family policy is strong jobs policy,&#34; she said. Porter previously expressed a fear that women could be left behind in the Biden plan, <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/30/biden-infrastructure-plan-working-women-see-make-or-break-moment.html\">CNBC reported.</a></p><p>Biden recently unveiled a $2.3 trillion public-works plan, the first of two plans aimed at upgrading the nation&#39;s infrastructure. The plan <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-in-bidens-infrastructure-bill-package-american-jobs-plan-2021-3\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"d37f5a88eac00946ba399e198e403bcc\">contains new funds</a> to repair deteriorating roads and bridges, eliminate lead pipes from water systems, and widen the reach of broadband networks.</p><p>The second part will be known as the American Family Plan, a package expected to contain a multi-trillion investment into childcare and education. Republicans are strongly critical of the Democratic infrastructure push, arguing that its tax hikes would slam into the economy.</p><p>Last month, Biden noted that 2 millions women had left the workforce since the pandemic started.</p><p>&#34;A lot of that is because so much extra weight of caregiving and responsibility is falling on their shoulders,&#34; he <a href=\"https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/speeches-remarks/2021/03/24/remarks-by-president-biden-at-an-event-to-mark-equal-pay-day/\">said at a White House event.</a> &#34;It causes women to miss work, cut hours, and leave their jobs and care for their children and aging loved ones.&#34;</p><p>&#34;How many men are staying home and doing it, and the woman&#39;s staying in the workforce?&#34; he asked.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/katie-porter-infrastructure-biden-plan-congress-big-mistake-women-family-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=XpbQkYBFqiI:viNHzz6QJR4:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=XpbQkYBFqiI:viNHzz6QJR4:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=XpbQkYBFqiI:viNHzz6QJR4:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/XpbQkYBFqiI\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 09 Apr 2021 21:52:11 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f7534860ab50d00184ad7b2?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"62a20ef3daa4561da230afc625d90ff6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn76@2020_2/2021/04/10/03-45-53-994_ffc5ad46e29669a6.webp","destWidth":3890,"destHeight":2918,"sourceBytes":253276,"destBytes":253276,"author":"jzeballos@businessinsider.com (Joseph Zeballos-Roig)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f75348f74fe5b0018a8e691?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn27@2020_3/2021/04/10/03-45-56-753_ae55159d4f9142f6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn43@2020_5/2021/04/10/03-46-06-040_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=XpbQkYBFqiI:viNHzz6QJR4:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn32@2020_1/2021/04/10/03-46-03-213_4889f660b2000ae8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=XpbQkYBFqiI:viNHzz6QJR4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn44@2020_6/2021/04/10/03-46-00-044_a275f73ea75c5895.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn75@2020_6/2021/04/10/03-46-00-486_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=XpbQkYBFqiI:viNHzz6QJR4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn44@2020_2/2021/04/10/03-46-02-679_bc52e45d41bb08b3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/XpbQkYBFqiI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn56@2020_2/2021/04/10/03-45-54-141_78a32d329a1e7528.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1618026331886},{"createdTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","updatedTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","title":"How to login to MyFitnessPal and track your weight loss, food, exercise, and more","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/myfitnesspal-login","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606f54ea4d3e410018b70152?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Woman working out with cellphone\" height=\"1414\" width=\"1885\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can access your MyFitnessPal account from your computer or the iOS and Android apps.\n<p class=\"copyright\">katleho Seisa/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>You can login to MyFitnessPal via the website or the iOS and Android apps, but you&#39;ll need to already have an account.</li>\n<li>If you&#39;re having issues logging into MyFitnessPal, make sure that there&#39;s not a service outage.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Visit Insider&#39;s Tech Reference library for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>For those trying to lose weight, or who simply want greater accountability when it comes to their exercise regimen, MyFitnessPal offers an easy way to track calories, workouts, and more in a single app. </p><p>While the company offers both a free and paid Premium model, even non-paying users with an account can access many of MyFitnessPal&#39;s most essential features when logged in. </p><p>MyFitnessPal requires members to have a registered account to use the app and website. But signing up for one requires little more than an email address and a password. </p><p>Once registered, signing in to your MyFitnessPal account, whether on the web or one of its mobile apps, takes just a few seconds. Here&#39;s how to do it. </p><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><h2><strong>How to login to MyFitnessPal on desktop</strong></h2><ol><li>Go to the <a href=\"https://www.myfitnesspal.com/\">MyFitnessPal website</a>.</li><li>Click the &#34;Log in&#34; option in the upper-right corner of the screen.<br><br><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606f510b30004b0019b26b90?format=jpeg\" alt=\"MyFitnessPal 5\" height=\"1300\" width=\"2031\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Click the Log In button in the top right corner of the MyFitnessPal homepage.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jennifer Still/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></li><li>Enter the email address and password associated with your account.<br><br><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606f50814d3e410018b70137?format=jpeg\" alt=\"MyFitnessPal 1\" height=\"707\" width=\"1203\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Enter your username and password on the MyFitnessPal website.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jennifer Still/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></li><li>Click &#34;Log in.&#34; <br><br>On the login page, you can check the box requesting the site remembers your login information so you don&#39;t have to re-enter it every time you visit the site. </li></ol></aside><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><h2>How to login to MyFitnessPal on an iPhone</h2><ol><li>Tap the MyFitnessPal app icon on your device&#39;s home screen to open the app. <br><br><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606f520f30004b0019b26b98?format=jpeg\" alt=\"MyFitnessPal 2\" height=\"1772\" width=\"1242\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tap the Log In link on the MyFitnessPal app&#39;s home screen.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jennifer Still/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></li><li>In the fields provided, enter your associated email address and password.</li><li>Now tap the &#34;Log in&#34; button to be taken to your personalized home screen. <br><br><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606f523030004b0019b26b99?format=jpeg\" alt=\"MyFitnessPal 3\" height=\"1532\" width=\"1242\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tap Log In after entering your username and password.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jennifer Still/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></li></ol></aside><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><h2>How to login to MyFitnessPal on Android</h2><ol><li>Open the MyFitnessPal app. </li><li>Enter your email address and password on the app&#39;s landing page. <br><br><br><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606f533530004b0019b26ba1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"MyFitnessPal 4\" height=\"845\" width=\"720\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You&#39;ll need to enter your username and password to log in.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jennifer Still/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></li><li>Choose &#34;Log in.&#34; </li></ol></aside><h2>How to troubleshoot logging into the MyFitnessPal app </h2><p>If you have problems logging into your account for any reason, you should try logging in through a different method to see if there&#39;s a problem. </p><p>For instance, if you&#39;re getting an invalid username or password option on the app, try using the same login info on the website to see if you&#39;re still having a problem. If you&#39;re still having an issue, you can try resetting your password by tapping the appropriate option on the login screen. </p><p>If the login problem you&#39;re experiencing is a server problem, MyFitnessPal recommends you check out the <a href=\"https://support.myfitnesspal.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006006752-ANNOUNCEMENTS-FROM-OUR-TECH-TEAM\">Announcements Page</a> to see if there&#39;s an outage. </p><p>If no outages are reported, they recommend you uninstall and reinstall the app and restart your device. And if all else fails, you can contact MyFitnessPal <a href=\"https://support.myfitnesspal.com/hc/en-us/requests/new\">support</a>.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"related-article-module-end-of-article\" +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/606f54ea4d3e410018b70152?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"503c7354ae9f8585a57c50f44153f29b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn9@2020_4/2021/04/10/03-45-32-760_9c2ca51733003a0a.webp","destWidth":1885,"destHeight":1414,"sourceBytes":68772,"destBytes":68772,"author":"insider@insider.com (Jennifer Still)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/606f54ea4d3e410018b70152?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn9@2020_4/2021/04/10/03-45-32-760_9c2ca51733003a0a.webp","https://i.insider.com/606f510b30004b0019b26b90?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn12@2020_3/2021/04/10/03-46-38-320_65baf03a7950fa24.webp","https://i.insider.com/606f50814d3e410018b70137?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn71@2020_3/2021/04/10/03-46-03-580_b927c2100bccd6e8.webp","https://i.insider.com/606f520f30004b0019b26b98?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn55@2020_1/2021/04/10/03-45-56-870_595fd786ca9a99b2.webp","https://i.insider.com/606f523030004b0019b26b99?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn96@2020_5/2021/04/10/03-46-00-943_42cc4cea17a7d46a.webp","https://i.insider.com/606f533530004b0019b26ba1?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn18@2020_4/2021/04/10/03-45-53-458_198f4ae53e148ebe.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn43@2020_5/2021/04/10/03-46-06-040_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=5LUK2BTnesA:zW7ozAbUciE:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn4@2020_1/2021/04/10/03-46-32-938_d53ac90769b601aa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=5LUK2BTnesA:zW7ozAbUciE:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn87@2020_5/2021/04/10/03-46-02-899_5a4885ac885aaf67.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn75@2020_6/2021/04/10/03-46-00-486_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=5LUK2BTnesA:zW7ozAbUciE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn15@2020_6/2021/04/10/03-46-03-935_1c82ff0912734a65.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/5LUK2BTnesA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn64@2020_4/2021/04/10/03-46-02-693_82517042b5544ca4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1618026331706},{"createdTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","updatedTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","title":"Despite 23andMe's declining revenue, CEO Anne Wojcicki said she's committed to consumer-first healthcare 'entirely outside the system'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/23andmes-ceo-committed-to-consumer-first-healthcare-entirely-outside-the-system-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6070a7b94943790018bb1b65?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Anne Wojcicki\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2220\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Emma McIntyre/Getty Images for MAKERS</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>23andMe CEO Anne Wojcicki reaffirmed her commitment to consumer-first healthcare in a HBR Live event.</li>\n<li>The company&#39;s <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biggest-obstacles-23andme-faces-in-going-public-s4-analysis-2021-3\">recent SPAC filing</a> demonstrated its plans to further develop its core business: direct-to-consumer genetics.</li>\n<li>&#34;Hands down, I just don&#39;t want to be in the system,&#34; Wojcicki said of the healthcare industry.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Direct-to-consumer genetics leader 23andMe has seen its revenue decline <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biggest-obstacles-23andme-faces-in-going-public-s4-analysis-2021-3\">in the past few years.</a></p><p>But founder and CEO Anne Wojcicki indicated no plan to stray from the company&#39;s original mission in a recent conversation at <a href=\"https://hbr.org/sponsored/2021/04/leaders-who-make-a-difference-a-special-live-issue-of-hbr\">HBR Live</a>, a day-long leadership conference held by the Harvard Business Review.</p><p>From the company&#39;s inception in 2007, the &#34;<a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/18/style/anne-wojcicki-23andme-genetics.html\">doyenne of DNA</a>&#34; said on Thursday that she drew on her experience in healthcare investing to craft 23andMe&#39;s number one guiding philosophy: the development of a platform &#34;that&#39;s genuinely in the best interest of customers and is entirely outside of the system.&#34; In wanting to put the consumer at the at the forefront of healthcare in a $4 trillion industry, Wojcicki said the company always knew controversy was, in some ways, part of the plan. </p><p>Now, with much of that regulatory and data privacy-related controversy behind them, 23andMe is <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/23andme-cofounder-anne-wojcicki-interview-explains-decision-spac-ipo-2021-2\">planning to go public</a> at a $3.6 billion valuation via a reverse merger with Virgin CEO Richard Branson&#39;s blank check holding company. </p><h2><strong>Keeping consumers front and center</strong></h2><p>Positioning 23andMe&#39;s mission-driven approach directly opposite the &#34;move fast, break things&#34; ethos of Silicon Valley, she said the long-term vision of the soon-to-be publicly traded company hasn&#39;t changed. Wojcicki pointed to its &#34;healthcare flywheel&#34; concept across both of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biggest-obstacles-23andme-faces-in-going-public-s4-analysis-2021-3\">23andMe&#39;s recent SEC filings</a>, as evidence of putting consumers front-and-center of their business model. </p><p>Its most financial and investor risk report, as <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biggest-obstacles-23andme-faces-in-going-public-s4-analysis-2021-3\">reviewed by Insider</a>, reaffirms Wojcicki&#39;s statements, showcasing that the company intends to invest in its core offering of direct-to-consumer genetics health and family ancestry reports, which make up the bulk of its business.</p><p>However, the S-4 filing showed that the company&#39;s efforts to use its genetic database in drug development, including its high-profile pharma partnership with GSK, stand on shakier ground. More alarmingly, 23andMe&#39;s overall revenue has fallen in recent years in line with the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/dna-test-company-pivot-strategies-23andme-color-invitae-helix-ancestry-2021-3\">overall downturn in the consumer genetics market</a>.</p><p>Despite changes in regulation over the years and mounting concerns over personal data privacy, she told HBR Live that giving consumers the ability to learn about their genetics and opt into research remains the company&#39;s vision for the future. 23andMe differentiates itself from competitors like Ancestry, she said, by focusing on engagement and the ability to be responsive to its users.</p><p>&#34;I&#39;m engaging you with your whole genome holistically, whether that&#39;s the ancestry side, the health side, or your family relationships, and I want to keep you coming back,&#34; Wojcicki said. Most companies or academic genetic databases are missing that high level of user engagement, she added.</p><p>As detailed in 23andMe&#39;s SPAC filing, the company faces significant obstacles in becoming profitable or turning any findings from its 10 million user-strong genetic database into drug or therapeutics.</p><p>Later in the HBR Live conversation, Wojcicki remained unconvinced that there are easy fixes within the existing US healthcare system. </p><p>&#34;You can play to follow the code to lead to a slightly better outcome, but like hands down, I just don&#39;t want to be in the system,&#34; Wojcicki said. &#34;Tell me who makes money if I&#39;m healthy at a hundred, and I will go in that path.&#34;</p><p>The closest thing at this point is Kaiser Permanente, she said in closing, referring to the 75-year-old health system whose organization structure incentivizes <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kaiser-permanente-ceo-on-the-social-determinants-of-health-2018-8\">an all-encompassing approach</a> to its members&#39; health outcomes. </p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/23andmes-ceo-committed-to-consumer-first-healthcare-entirely-outside-the-system-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=wJbv0ueIy-E:Nz5yb4ndLaY:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img
