There's also a 32,000 square foot sports arena, as well as 400 acres of land for couples to explore together.</p><p>But if that's too much action, just retreat to one of the large 188 suites with log-burning fireplaces, starry ceilings, and King-sized beds, many of which are heart-shaped. All rooms, including the entry-level suites, offer heart-shaped tubs, while some, including the Champagne Tower Select and the Roman Tower, feature the famed 7-foot tall in-room Champagne Tower tub. As the name implies, it's shaped like a giant champagne coupe and comes with the addition of a heart-shaped pool, a dry sauna, and a rain shower.&#160;</p><p><strong>COVID status and policies available <a href=\"https://www.covepoconoresorts.com/coronavirus/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</strong></p>\n\tHotel Vermont - Burlington, Vermont\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89ca89d260780019341dcb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Hotel_Vermont_Whirlpool_King_Bedrom\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hotel Vermont</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fvermont.en-gb.html%3F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Book Hotel Vermont</a></h3><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Category:</strong> Boutique</p><p><strong>Typical starting price: </strong>$179 for a standard room/$259 for jetted tub rooms</p><p><strong>Best for:</strong> Couples</p><p><strong>On-site amenities: </strong>farm-to-table restaurants, fitness center, massage room</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> The hotel is a Trip Advisor Traveler's Choice winner and is dog-friendly.</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Rooms are purposely minimalistic with simple dorm-like furnishings, a small bathroom, and lack of storage space</p></aside><p>Located in Vermont's largest city and overlooking Lake Champlain, <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fvermont.en-gb.html%3F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Hotel Vermont</a> is Burlington's only independent LEED Certified hotel. The hotel offers 125 sleek and charming guest rooms, plus two outdoor terraces and Brick, an outdoor wood-fired kitchen and bar, which remains open despite COVID.</p><p>Upgraded King Bedrooms come decked out with jetted tubs that are large enough for two. These baths straddle the bedroom and bathroom and accompany a natural stone tile walk-in shower, gas fireplace, 40\" LED TV, and luxurious bedding. Each room is also stocked with locally-made products including amenities from Vermont Soap Company and Vermont Flannel Bathrobes.</p><p>There are also sleep-encouraging amenities available for purchase including aromatherapy, flannel pajamas, and hot toddies with rum or whiskey.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 status and policies available <a href=\"https://hotelvt.com/covid-19-health-and-safety-updates/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</strong></p>\n\tThe Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas - Las Vegas, Nevada\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606e006c70954f0019195b61?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cosmopolitan Las Vegas guest room\" height=\"769\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Trip Advisor</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.expedia.com%2FLas-Vegas-Hotels-The-Cosmopolitan-Of-Las-Vegas.h3818880.Hotel-Information\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Book The Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas</a></h3><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Category:</strong> Luxury</p><p><strong>Typical starting price: </strong>$143 for a standard room/$350 for a terrace suite</p><p><strong>Best for:</strong> Couples, groups of friends, first-time visitors to Las Vegas</p><p><strong>On-site amenities:&#160;</strong>Casino, great on-site dining and nightlife, multiple pools, spa</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> A bevy of amazing restaurants, and a central Strip location near other resorts and connected to The Shops at Crystals.</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Young and rowdy crowd, smoking is allowed inside lounges and the Race &#38; Sports Book, as well as on the casino floor</p></aside><p>Located in the center of the Las Vegas Strip, <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.expedia.com%2FLas-Vegas-Hotels-The-Cosmopolitan-Of-Las-Vegas.h3818880.Hotel-Information\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">The Cosmopolitan</a> is a sleek, stylish gaming resort with some of Sin City's best restaurants. We are Las Vegas enthusiasts and this hotel remains one of our favorite Vegas properties, with numerous stays clocked, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cosmopolitan-autograph-collection-hotel-review-las-vegas\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">which we've reviewed</a>.</p><p>A Terrace Suite doubles down on luxury with sumptuous bubbler Japanese soaking tubs. While they don't have jets (per traditional Japanese custom), they do feel like being immersed in a bath of champagne bubbles. They're adjacent to spacious rain shower-equipped bathrooms and there's also a 160-square-foot private balcony with views of the Bellagio fountains, a King-sized bed, and a large sitting area with doors off the bedroom. Rooms are tech-forward, with an iPad controlling all the lighting and room settings such as curtains. For a full jetted tub, consider the Wraparound Terrace Suite.</p><p>For a splurge, book a Bungalow room with a private heated plunge pool on an outdoor terrace.&#160;</p><p><strong>COVID-19 status and policies available <a href=\"https://www.cosmopolitanlasvegas.com/travel-information-covid-19\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</strong></p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cosmopolitan-autograph-collection-hotel-review-las-vegas\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full hotel review for The Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas</a></h3>\n\tSybaris Pool Suites - The pool comes complete with a tropical waterfall, misting steam room, and bedroom loft connected to a 10-foot waterslide that leads directly into the pool below. On top of all that, guests have their own parking garage connected directly to the two-story suite for private entry, and other highlights include a massage chair.</p><p>The property itself is designed to evoke romance and let couples relax privately, including ambient lighting, rose petals on the bed, the ability to schedule mini-getaways for an afternoon.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 status and policies available <a href=\"https://www.sybaris.com/covid-update/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</strong></p>\n\tThe Roxbury at Stratton Falls - There's a two-story superhero-themed cottage, a Cinderella cottage, and rooms inspired by \"The Wizard of Oz\" and \"Gilligan's Island.\"</p><p>The two-story King Arthur-esque Crown of the Pendragons Cottage, located in <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fthe-roxbury-roxbury.en-gb.html%3F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">The Roxbury at Stratton Falls</a> property, offers medieval theming, with dragons and swords and chain-mail aplenty. The highlight is most certainly the massive 86-gallon circular tub, which is technically not a hot tub, and far too spectacular to even remotely qualify as a bathtub. The tub rests in the center of a dedicated relaxation room, underneath a three-tiered, 20 foot-high crown chandelier. There are also chaise relaxation loungers, a 60\" television, full-size refrigerator, microwave, and wet bar sink, plus an open-air balcony with a \"drawbridge.\"&#160;</p><p><strong>COVID-19 status and policies available <a href=\"https://theroxburyexperience.com/covid-19-safety-operating-guidelines/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</strong></p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/roxbury-hotel-review-catskills\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full hotel review of The Roxbury at Stratton Falls</a></h3>\n\tTrappeur's Crossing Resort - Steamboat Springs, Colorado\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89cc7cd260780019341dd2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BL6105 in Bear Lodge at Trappeur&#39;s Crossing Resort\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Trappeur’s Crossing Resort</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Ftrappeurs-crossing-resort-by-resortquest.en-gb.html%3Flabel%3Dgen173nr-1DCAso7AFCKHRyYXBwZXVycy1jcm9zc2luZy1yZXNvcnQtYnktcmVzb3J0cXVlc3RIM1gEaKQCiAEBmAEJuAEHyAEM2AED6AEBiAIBqAIDuALrhKf8BcACAdICJDA3NTc1NWFlLWVmZWUtNGUwYy05ZmM4LTFhOTU3YmQxZjJjMdgCBOACAQ%3Bsid%3D0694b031d8e2b987d37291e7ea4ff96b%3Bdist%3D0%26group_adults%3D2%26group_children%3D0%26keep_landing%3D1%26no_rooms%3D1%26sb_price_type%3Dtotal%26type%3Dtotal%26\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Book Bear Lodge at Trappeur's Crossing Resort</a></h3><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Category:</strong> Resort</p><p><strong>Typical starting price: </strong>$575 for a five-bedroom Bear Lodge cabin</p><p><strong>Best for:</strong> Families, large groups</p><p><strong>On-site amenities: </strong>4 pools, 10 hot tubs, 2 tennis courts, fitness center, business center, shuttle service, 3 18-hole golf courses, fly-fishing, hiking and biking trails</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> The resort offers a free shuttle that drops off guests anywhere in town upon request</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> The sauna is closed (as are the communal hot tubs) in response to COVID, some resort amenities are dated&#160;&#160;</p></aside><p>Located only two blocks from the Champagne Powder slopes in Steamboat Springs, Colorado, <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Ftrappeurs-crossing-resort-by-resortquest.en-gb.html%3Flabel%3Dgen173nr-1DCAso7AFCKHRyYXBwZXVycy1jcm9zc2luZy1yZXNvcnQtYnktcmVzb3J0cXVlc3RIM1gEaKQCiAEBmAEJuAEHyAEM2AED6AEBiAIBqAIDuALrhKf8BcACAdICJDA3NTc1NWFlLWVmZWUtNGUwYy05ZmM4LTFhOTU3YmQxZjJjMdgCBOACAQ%3Bsid%3D0694b031d8e2b987d37291e7ea4ff96b%3Bdist%3D0%26group_adults%3D2%26group_children%3D0%26keep_landing%3D1%26no_rooms%3D1%26sb_price_type%3Dtotal%26type%3Dtotal%26\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Trappeur's Crossing Resort</a> is a massive property with six different lodges featuring multiple types of vacation rental condos.</p><p>Within Bear Lodge &#8212; the newest accommodations at <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Ftrappeurs-crossing-resort-by-resortquest.en-gb.html%3Flabel%3Dgen173nr-1DCAso7AFCKHRyYXBwZXVycy1jcm9zc2luZy1yZXNvcnQtYnktcmVzb3J0cXVlc3RIM1gEaKQCiAEBmAEJuAEHyAEM2AED6AEBiAIBqAIDuALrhKf8BcACAdICJDA3NTc1NWFlLWVmZWUtNGUwYy05ZmM4LTFhOTU3YmQxZjJjMdgCBOACAQ%3Bsid%3D0694b031d8e2b987d37291e7ea4ff96b%3Bdist%3D0%26group_adults%3D2%26group_children%3D0%26keep_landing%3D1%26no_rooms%3D1%26sb_price_type%3Dtotal%26type%3Dtotal%26\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Trappeur's Crossing</a> &#8212; the five-bedroom, five-bathroom BL6105 condo is one of two on property with a private courtyard, including an outdoor fireplace, and a large gas BBQ grill. The pi&#232;ce de r&#233;sistance is the condo's private outdoor hot tub, with ski mountain views, and is perfect for warming up at the end of a cold day on the slopes. The unit sleeps up to 12 and includes a washer/dryer, as well as a fully-equipped gourmet kitchen, stainless steel appliances, a four-burner gas cook-top stove, and luxurious wood cabinetry. There's also a wine cooler, spacious living area, and gas log fireplace.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 status and policies available <a href=\"https://www.simplysteamboat.com/Steamboat-Winter-Health-and-Safety.php?webSyncID=883036cb-b5be-ec3b-9e7c-0d0a49622c87&#38;sessionGUID=61b3834c-2e04-1967-484d-9845e1e177a8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</strong></p>\n\tSanctuary on Camelback Mountain Resort & Spa​ - Paradise Valley, Arizona\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89ca0e9e9fe40019009c9d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Sanctuary_Spa Suite Bath Banner\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Sanctuary on Camelback Mountain Resort &#38; Spa​</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fsanctuary-camelback-mountain.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Book Sanctuary on Camelback Mountain Resort &#38; Spa</a></h3><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Category:</strong> Luxury</p><p><strong>Typical starting price: </strong>$340 for a standard room/$798 for a spa suite</p><p><strong>Best for:</strong> Couples, spa enthusiasts, travelers with pets</p><p><strong>On-site amenities: </strong>Spa services, infinity pool, fitness classes, tennis, golf, hiking on scenic Camelback Mountain</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> The resort is pet-friendly and welcomes cats and dogs up to 50 pounds and spoils them with treats and several pet-friendly areas</p><p><strong>Cons</strong>: Some rooms have parking lot views, breakfast is not included and expensive</p></aside><p>Only 10 minutes from Old Town Scottsdale, the 53-acre <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fsanctuary-camelback-mountain.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Sanctuary on Camelback Mountain Resort &#38; Spa</a> is located in tony Paradise Valley and is known for its 109&#160;luxurious casitas, suites, and villas.</p><p>There's also a Zen, Asian-inspired destination spa, one of Arizona's finest, with Watsu water treatments, a labyrinth walking meditation, and a reflection pond. Though it's been years since our last visit, we look back on our stay here especially fondly.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fsanctuary-camelback-mountain.en-gb.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Sanctuary</a>'s spa vibe continues in the resort's 1,200 square-foot Spa Suites, where private outdoor soaking tubs and chaise relaxation loungers are the focal point of your own patio, each designed to bring the spa into the room itself. Elsewhere in the suite, there's a living area with a fireplace and wet bar plus a rain shower. Rooms are contemporary and design-forward, offering a seating area, free Wi-Fi, and flat-screen cable TV with Google Chromecast, as well as robes and flip flops, Molton Brown bath amenities, bath salts, and a pillow-top mattress with plush linens.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 status and policies available <a href=\"https://www.sanctuaryoncamelback.com/covid-19/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</strong></p>\n\tMiraval Resort and Spa - Tucson, Arizona\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8dd7b8c21cfb0019468d66?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best hotels with private jacuzzis\" height=\"952\" width=\"1270\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Miraval Resort</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.hotels.com/ho535389/miraval-resort-and-spa-all-inclusive-tucson-united-states-of-america/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Book Miraval Resort and Spa</a></h3><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Category:</strong> All-inclusive luxury</p><p><strong>Typical starting price: </strong>$609 for all-inclusive standard room/$1,049 for all-inclusive Desert Sky Suite or Solace Retreat</p><p><strong>Best for:</strong> Couples, spa and wellness enthusiasts</p><p><strong>On-site amenities: </strong>Spa services, pool, fitness and wellness classes, tennis, golf, hiking on scenic Camelback Mountain</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Meals and activities are all-inclusive offering tremendous value, exceptional quality of the food</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Though it offers strong value, the price alone might be a barrier to entry for many</p></aside><p>Located on 400 acres outside Tucson in the shadow of the Santa Catalina Mountains, <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.hotels.com/ho535389/miraval-resort-and-spa-all-inclusive-tucson-united-states-of-america/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Miraval</a> is a world-renowned destination spa resort prioritizing wellness.</p><p>The Life in Balance Spa, which we have visited and recommend without hesitation, features a myriad of services including Ayurveda, energy work, traditional massage, and acupuncture. Though some spa services are paused, outdoor therapies are available.&#160;</p><p>The 800 square foot Desert Sky Double Suite is large and features a hot tub plus a separate walk-in shower. There are also zen touches such as a meditation pillow from an organic pillow menu, a Tibetan singing bowl, mindful coloring books, a community journal, and an essential oil diffuser, available on request. Space is ample, with a patio for reflection, a cozy fireplace in the living room, and a separate dining room.&#160;</p><p>Or, the Solace Retreat, while smaller, is tailor-made for spa-like relaxation, with its own outdoor patio with a private hot tub, a celestial rain shower, and a lounge area with a fire pit. Other touches include an aromatherapy diffuser, fluffy cotton bathrobes, an indoor soaking tub, and a sitting area, plus views of the Santa Catalina Mountains.</p><p>The resort is a digital, device-free space, where guests are asked to unplug at check-in and place their phones and devices in a special \"sleeping bag\" to better center themselves.</p><p>Room rates also include a $175 nightly credit, all meals, and more than 200 classes and activities ranging from outback hiking and biking to challenge courses. For additional fees, offerings include equine therapy (such as painting with the side of a horse as the canvas!), \"conscious cooking\" classes, beekeeping workshops, and wine tasting. All food is local, with mindful eating of fresh, high-quality ingredients an integral part of <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.hotels.com/ho535389/miraval-resort-and-spa-all-inclusive-tucson-united-states-of-america/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">the Miraval</a> experience.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 status and policies available <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.hotels.com/ho535389/miraval-resort-and-spa-all-inclusive-tucson-united-states-of-america/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</strong></p>\n\tFAQ: Is it safe to stay in hotels right now?\n\t\n\t<h3><strong>Is it safe to stay in hotels?</strong></h3><p>The CDC now says&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-fully-vaccinated-travelers-can-now-travel-in-the-us-2021-4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"303f476a077d8164f790a3cf23ec1cf6\">fully vaccinated people can safely travel in the US</a>. And, with added caution,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/are-hotels-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"1de2b7f85c20ff802b88e2dddc599fe1\">experts we spoke to said it is safe to stay in a hotel</a>.&#160;</p><p>Of course, there's no guarantee of safety when it comes to travel. We recommend following CDC guidelines and wearing a mask in public, using hand sanitizer, and following social distancing.</p><h3>What are the risks of staying in hotels?</h3><p>Potential problem areas include any places where people might gather, such as hotel check-in desks, luggage valet stations, elevators, restaurants, and other indoor venues.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/are-hotels-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Experts say</a> that the closer you are to someone, and the longer you're close to someone that's infectious, the more likely you are to get infected. The most&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-double-masking-makes-masks-50-more-effective-2021-2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\" data-uri=\"35f9a43e7e0e0a17d7d9c06bcfdce447\">recent health guidelines also suggest double masking</a> for added protection, so you may want to consider layering up.&#160;</p><p>And if you imagine that you are sparing yourself risk exposure by traveling to a remote or rural hotel, make sure to check on the prevalence of community spread.&#160;</p><p>Regardless be sure to check up on hotels' policies regarding shared amenities and common areas.</p><h3 id=\"what-are-hotels'-new-cleaning-policies?\"><strong>What are hotels' new cleaning policies?</strong></h3><p>Most major hotel chains <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hotel-precautions-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">have announced</a> wide-reaching new cleaning policies made in combination with health experts. These policies focus on social-distancing and contact-free services such as virtual check-in and out, digital keys, limited dining and housekeeping, extra sanitization efforts, and more.</p>\n\tMore 11:45:31","updatedTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","title":"How compact cars can jump football fields in rally races","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/rally-cars-are-compact-cars-that-jump-hundreds-feet-2020-9","description":"<div style=\"position:relative; overflow:hidden; padding-bottom:56.25%\">\n<iframe src=\"https://cdn.jwplayer.com/players/bPjVr1pE-jZbcmOYf.html\" width=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" style=\"position:absolute;\" allow=\"fullscreen\"></iframe>\n</div><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The longest jump ever made in the World Rally Championship was 278 feet</li>\n<li>Most rally cars are made from tiny little compact cars that can barely handle potholes</li>\n<li>We explore how rally cars&#39; design and engineering makes them capable of such massive jumps.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider&#39;s homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p><em style=\"color: #222222; font-family: Georgia, Times, sans-serif;\">Following is a transcript of the video.</em></p><p><strong>Narrator: </strong>This right here is the longest jump ever recorded in the World Rally Championship - 278 feet! That&#39;s nearly the length of a football field! So what kind of car did driver Sebastien Loeb have for this incredible feat? A Citroën C4, a simple European compact car known for its safety and reliability. But how do you send an average economy car into orbit and safely back down again? You transform everything that makes it an average car. From adding a suspension that can handle the landing to an aerodynamic body kit that will prevent it from flying away, it&#39;s all in how rally cars get completely re-engineered from the inside out.</p><p>The first important difference between rally cars and road cars is a more aerodynamic design that makes flying through the air a whole lot easier - and safer. Let&#39;s compare a rally car like Hyundai&#39;s i20 WRC model and the automaker&#39;s i20 compact car that it&#39;s based on. Besides both being built on the same steel shell, they look completely different. One screams &#34;race car&#34; while the other screams &#34;new parents&#34;. But those eye-catching additions aren&#39;t just for show. Once the i20 takes flight, it&#39;s aerodynamic additions make sure it comes back down as soon as   possible and on its wheels</p><p>This requires creating downforce, one of the most important parts of racing in general. Downforce is the downward vertical force on a car that keeps it glued to the ground. In a sport like IndyCar racing that takes place on a smooth flat tarmac, creating downward force is important for simply giving racers more grip in tight corners. But in rallying where there&#39;s constant elevation changes on loose gravel and snow, downforce keeps cars from flying off the track</p><p>To generate downforce, rally cars like Hyundai&#39;s i20 WRC are fitted with sloped carbon fiber wings throughout the body. While most obvious is the six-foot long one in the back, there are also small wings positioned over the wheels. These are known as dive planes.  Although they may be a different size and shape, their function is the same: As the car drives forward at high speed, it has to cut through air. High pressure air forced under the car creates an upward force on the vehicle known as lift. The wings counteract this lift with downforce. Incoming air forced over the car is slowed down and pushed upward by the wings. The equal and opposite reaction is slower-moving high pressure air now pushing the car downward.This is the downforce needed to keep the car properly balanced.</p><p>This downforce is especially useful for jumps. In a rally car that constantly finds itself in the air, having plenty of downforce to stay level and coming straight back down on all four wheels is especially important. Just ask driver Petter Solberg who lost his rear wing in the 2005 Rally Finland.</p><p>For the air going underneath the car is a piece known as the splitter added up front right under the bumper. Just as its name suggests, it &#34;splits&#34; the air traveling at the car, sending tighter low pressure air underneath and quickly out the back before it can enact too much lift on the car. Large amounts of slower-moving high pressure air are forced over the car, creating extra downforce. This again helps keep the car level as it takes flight. Without it, the car would be flipped backward right as it took off!</p><p>But even if you can send a car flying into the air level and straight down on all four wheels, it means nothing if that car doesn&#39;t have a suspension that can handle the landing. That&#39;s why the suspension that ends up on a WRC rally car looks nothing like what you&#39;ll find on your typical road car, especially the dampers. Dampers or shock absorbers, are the key part of a rally car&#39;s suspension that keeps it from crumpling to pieces when the car comes back down.</p><p>On a regular road car, every time your car bounces over a rough surface or hits a nasty bump, the intense energy and vibrations on your wheels are absorbed by a large coil spring. But while those springs are great at absorbing energy, they need something in the way to keep them from bouncing back uncontrollably like a trampoline. That&#39;s where dampers come in. Positioned inside the spring, they&#39;re made up of a long telescopic body with a piston and oil inside. As the spring compresses during a heavy bump or impact on your wheel, so does the damper, and that piston slides down through the oil. As the spring bounces back, the damper is what keeps it under control, as the oil slows down the piston&#39;s return and converts that energy into heat. On a road car the goal of the suspension and dampers is to keep the ride as smooth and comfortable as possible, ideally so you barely notice those bumps at all.</p><p>But on a WRC rally car, comfort is the engineers&#39; last concern. There&#39;s no question there are bumps and bangs coming. You&#39;ve got 1.2 tons of metal crashing down from heights of over 3 feet. The goal is for the car to survive - and keep going as fast as possible. This calls for dampers twice as big and strong so they can handle more intense compression. They&#39;re built thick, heavy and tuned with the intention of absorbing an enormous impact, not making sure the passengers are cozy.</p><p>A motorsport like rallying also requires an additional canister connected to the damper. In an especially active damper, oil temperatures are reaching up to 248 degrees Fahrenheit. This can cause your shock absorbers to overheat, which leads to them compressing irregularly and the driver losing control of the vehicle. An additional canister, or &#34;remote reservoir&#34;, allows you to carry more oil and have a place where it can cool down.</p><p>The most crucial feature rally car dampers have though is how adjustable they are. With knobs found on both the dampers and throughout the car, everything from ride height, to compression speed, to how fast they rebound can be adjusted. For rally courses that feature more jumps, drivers need a car that&#39;s both higher off the ground with a suspension that they can count on bouncing back immediately and as smoothly as possible when they make a heavy landing.</p><p>Just as important to the rally car&#39;s suspension though are the tires. Even if your shock absorbers can handle a jump, if your tires collapse on impact then you aren&#39;t going anywhere. In a league like the WRC, teams have many different types of bespoke tires. For gravel courses where jumps are especially found, the most important thing to have is thick tires with stiff reinforced sidewalls for puncture resistance. </p><p>On a normal road tire, tiny steel belts inside the tread provide extra support to the tire&#39;s contact patch. This is the part of the tire that touches the road. However, the tire&#39;s sidewalls are thin and flexible, to make for a more comfortable ride. Gravel rally car tires are the exact opposite, with little support under the contact patch, but sidewalls that are practically bulletproof. This is to prevent hard cornering and hard impacts from causing the rally tire to fold over on itself, or remove itself from the wheel.</p><p>Rally tires are also softer than regular tires in terms of the rubber compound used. This allows them to absorb more bumps and shocks. It also gives them more grip when ripping down a gravel stage or landing a high impact jump. The softer compound provides this but won&#39;t last as long as your street tire. Fortunately they aren&#39;t needed to last nearly as long, just until the end of the race.</p><p>But even if your car has the aerodynamics to soar through the air smoothly, and a suspension that can handle the landing, it&#39;s going to mean nothing if your car&#39;s undercarriage isn&#39;t protected properly. The undercarriage has many exposed components, like fuel lines that are easily penetrable by sharp rocks and race debris. Consumer cars use carpeting for the underside of the vehicle to reduce road noise and improve airflow, but this does nothing to prevent damage. So the i20 WRC is fitted with three quarter-inch thick steel plates bolted to the underside of the car. Known as skid plates, or sump guards, these tools can also be made from carbon fiber or aluminum. Their main objective is to protect the oil pan, transmission, gear box, and fuel tank from loose stones and debris.</p><p>Skid plates help drivers against a number of major car problems, the most dangerous being fuel and oil leaks. While these two issues usually just result in engine failure, they have also caused a number of major fires in the WRC. Esapekka Lappi&#39;s unsolved car fire at March&#39;s Rally Mexico is believed to have been caused by an oil leak. Skid plates drastically improve your chances of avoiding them.</p><p>Still the skid plate alone can&#39;t protect you from everything. Just ask driver Elfyn Evans who landed on nothing but his sump guard at last year&#39;s Rally Estonia, and suffered two compression fractures, cutting his season short. No matter how prepared you may be, some rally car disasters are just unavoidable.</p><p>So while cars only take to the air in NASCAR and Formula 1 after something has already gone wrong, in the World Rally Championship it&#39;s a major part of the competition. Between being equipped with an aerodynamic body, heavy duty suspension, and a steel plated undercarriage, jumping nearly the length of a football field is something these incredible vehicles can handle day to day. While they may be based on compact cars that can barely handle a pothole, the right kind of engineering can transform them from family vehicles into high-flying tanks.</p><p><em>EDITOR&#39;S NOTE: This video was originally published in September 2020.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/mirF73mrFdY\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 09 Apr 2021 19:34:07 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f6ce9a1c4049200115cb797?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"3906fb67784d4b832115607c80a64ae2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn39@2020_5/2021/04/10/03-46-38-422_cbfff8373d36818f.webp","destWidth":1440,"destHeight":1080,"sourceBytes":134070,"destBytes":134070,"author":"insider@insider.com (Daniel Gessner)","articleImgCdnMap":{"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn43@2020_5/2021/04/10/03-46-06-040_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mirF73mrFdY:szZIE8torUY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn21@2020_4/2021/04/10/03-46-04-873_67501b52ad4a1b51.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mirF73mrFdY:szZIE8torUY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn59@2020_4/2021/04/10/03-46-02-741_1d376880c6f7817f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn75@2020_6/2021/04/10/03-46-00-486_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mirF73mrFdY:szZIE8torUY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn48@2020_1/2021/04/10/03-46-00-117_89ed21dc3b740cec.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/mirF73mrFdY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn27@2020_1/2021/04/10/03-46-33-000_d5010dd430d1ac5e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1618026331671},{"createdTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","updatedTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","title":"The Ingenuity Mars helicopter's blades are spinning ahead of its first flight - making the NASA team 'nervous and excited'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/mars-helicopter-spins-blades-first-flight-nasa-team-nervous-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6070d5f7a451820019b3a683?format=jpeg\" alt=\"mars ingenuity helicopter rotor blades spin\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Perseverance rover photographed the Ingenuity helicopter before (left) and after (right) it spun its rotor blades.\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/JPL-Caltech/ASU</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-ingenuity-helicopter-photographed-mars-surface-before-flight-2021-4\">NASA&#39;s Ingenuity helicopter</a> has spun its blades and charged up with solar energy on Mars.</li>\n<li>On Monday, Ingenuity will <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/watch-live-nasa-fly-ingenuity-mars-helicopter-first-time-2021-4\">attempt the first controlled flight on Mars</a>.</li>\n<li>The NASA team is nervous and excited for the high-stakes experimental flight.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>NASA&#39;s Ingenuity helicopter is charging up and spinning its blades in preparation to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/watch-live-nasa-fly-ingenuity-mars-helicopter-first-time-2021-4\">fly above the Martian surface</a>.</p><p>The 4-pound drone is set to lift off early on Monday, rise 10 feet above the dusty red ground of Mars&#39; Jezero Crater, then gently touch back down. The entire flight should last about 40 seconds, but it could forever change the way NASA explores other planets.</p><p>Future Mars helicopters could scout out canyons and mountains that rovers can&#39;t access, fly in and out of craters, or even do reconnaissance for astronauts. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6070de244943790018bb1c5e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"mimi aung ingenuity helicopter mars perseverance\" height=\"1299\" width=\"1732\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Ingenuity project manager MiMi Aung speaks at a press conference on February 16, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/Bill Ingalls</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>As for Ingenuity, if its first flight goes well, the rotorcraft will attempt up to four increasingly difficult sojourns into the thin Martian air after that.</p><p>&#34;Each world gets only one first flight,&#34; MiMi Aung, the project manager for Ingenuity, said in a briefing on Friday. &#34;The Wright brothers achieved the first flight on Earth. Ingenuity is poised to go for being the first on Mars.&#34;</p><p>The $85 million chopper has completed most of its system checkouts, and its solar panels are absorbing enough energy to power its flight. It spun its blades for the first time on Thursday, though that spin was much slower than it will need to be for flight - 50 rotations per minute instead of 2,500. </p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">-NASA JPL  (@NASAJPL) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1380404668069650437?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">April 9, 2021</a></blockquote><script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#34;So far so good, knock on wood,&#34; Aung said.</p><p>Late on Friday, the helicopter is set to test out a full-speed spin.</p><p>Meanwhile, the Perseverance rover, which carried Ingenuity to the red planet, has driven to an outlook about 210 feet away. From its perch, the rover is ready to watch and record footage as its helicopter stowaway takes flight.</p><p>But nobody is sure Ingenuity will succeed. So as flight day approaches, the engineers behind the helicopter are anticipating the moment of truth when they&#39;ll find out. Ingenuity will conduct its entire flight autonomously, and it takes at least 8 minutes for a signal from Mars to travel to Earth, and vice versa. So once the process begins, the Ingenuity team can only bite their nails and wait for the signal of success.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606f4a6f4d3e410018b70112?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NASA Perseverance \" height=\"2160\" width=\"2880\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Perseverance took a selfie with Ingenuity on April 6, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/JPL-Caltech/MSSS/Seán Doran</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>&#34;I&#39;m feeling a lot of emotions,&#34; Josh Ravich, who leads Ingenuity&#39;s mechanics teams, told Insider. &#34;A lot of the team, myself included, are very hesitant to celebrate prematurely. So even as we&#39;re making really exciting milestones, getting prepared for first flight, we&#39;re still holding our enthusiasm until that flight happens.&#34;</p><p>The feeling extends to NASA&#39;s leaders, too.</p><p>&#34;We&#39;re all kind of a little bit nervous and excited at the same time,&#34; Thomas Zurbuchen, the agency&#39;s associate administrator for science, told Insider. &#34;We&#39;re all ready, but we&#39;ll all feel better when it&#39;s done - and successful.&#34;</p><h2>Flying through air thinner than on the top of Mount Everest</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2110e040c1f316e20b1493?format=jpeg\" alt=\"mars helicopter ingenuity nasa gif\" height=\"360\" width=\"640\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://mars.nasa.gov/resources/24935/nasa-mars-helicopter-ingenuity-animations/\" target=\"_blank\">NASA/JPL-Caltech</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>If the full-speed spin test goes well, NASA <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/watch-live-nasa-fly-ingenuity-mars-helicopter-first-time-2021-4\">expects Ingenuity to fly around 3:30 a.m. ET on Monday</a>. That will be about 12:30 p.m. on Mars&#39; Jezero Crater, when the sun is bright. NASA expects winds to be helicopter-friendly at that time, too.</p><p>Even if conditions are perfect, though, flying on Mars is tough. The air there has just 1% the density of Earth&#39;s atmosphere, making Ingenuity&#39;s task the equivalent of flying three times higher than the peak of Mount Everest. To catch enough lift with so few molecules to push against, the helicopter&#39;s two pairs of blades will have to spin in opposite directions at a speed roughly eight times faster than a passenger helicopter on Earth.</p><p>&#34;There were some people who doubted we could generate enough lift to fly in that thin Martian atmosphere,&#34; Amiee Quon, who tested Ingenuity in a Mars-simulation chamber on Earth, said in the Friday briefing.</p><p>It worked in the test chamber, but flying on Mars is a different story.</p><p>&#34;There are four possible outcomes. The first is for success. Second, partial success. Third could be insufficient or no data coming back, which means we&#39;ll have to take more time to figure out what&#39;s happened. Or it could be failure,&#34; Aung said.</p><h2>&#39;High-risk, high-reward&#39;</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60304d03623bd30012bcc5a0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"perseverance rover landing mars nasa mission control celebrates\" height=\"1280\" width=\"1706\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Perseverance surface-operations team celebrates the rover&#39;s landing from their mission-control room at NASA&#39;s Jet Propulsion Laboratory, February 18, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://images.nasa.gov/details-PIA23723\" target=\"_blank\">NASA/JPL-Caltech</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Because Ingenuity is a demonstration of technology that&#39;s never been used on Mars before, it&#39;s &#34;high-risk, high-reward,&#34; according to Zurbuchen.</p><p>&#34;There&#39;s a lot of a lot of things that could certainly go wrong, I guess, besides crashing or not working at all. You can imagine 1,000 ways that either of those things could happen,&#34; Ravich said.</p><p>The worst-case scenario, he added, is that Ingenuity doesn&#39;t get off the ground at all. Even if it flies a little bit and crashes, the team could potentially salvage data from the robot and learn lessons for future space helicopters.</p><p>If the rotorcraft does fly and land smoothly, even just for this first flight, Ingenuity could revolutionize the way NASA investigates other planets.</p><p>&#34;Suppose that it does, in fact, work. What we will have proven is that we can add an aerial dimension to discovery and exploration on Mars,&#34; Zurbuchen said. &#34;That aerial dimension, of course, opens up aspects of science and overall exploration that, frankly, at this moment in time, are only our dreams.&#34;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/mars-helicopter-spins-blades-first-flight-nasa-team-nervous-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=5I6yjs41JOc:gcXxFlAqi7s:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=5I6yjs41JOc:gcXxFlAqi7s:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=5I6yjs41JOc:gcXxFlAqi7s:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=5I6yjs41JOc:gcXxFlAqi7s:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=5I6yjs41JOc:gcXxFlAqi7s:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=5I6yjs41JOc:gcXxFlAqi7s:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=5I6yjs41JOc:gcXxFlAqi7s:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=5I6yjs41JOc:gcXxFlAqi7s:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/5I6yjs41JOc\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 09 Apr 2021 23:28:31 11:45:31","updatedTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","title":"This dog DNA test helped me figure out what breed my rescue dog is and what health conditions to watch out for","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/embark-dog-dna-test-review","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>If you buy through our links, we may earn money from affiliate partners. <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Fembark-breed-ancestry-identification%2Fdp%2F167898\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bec881f1011420b7a495b67?format=jpeg\" alt=\"39120519_1151266448373053_8269353345353777152_o (1)\" height=\"1366\" width=\"1821\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Embark Facebook</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Embark&#39;s <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Fembark-breed-ancestry-identification%2Fdp%2F167898\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">dog DNA test</a> determines your dog&#39;s breed and checks for genetic health conditions.</li>\n<li>Veterinarians and customer service reps are also available to answer questions about your pet&#39;s results.</li>\n<li>We used the test to learn more about our rescue dog, Nellie. </li>\n</ul><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"5e1c9a3624fe124fdf592585\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Breed + Health Kit (small)</bi-shortcode><p>Even if you picked up your puppy from the pound with no information - and you&#39;ve been guessing or making up breeds to satisfy strangers&#39; curiosity ever since - there is a way to actually know the precise origins of your furry best friend.</p><p>Enter the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Fembark-breed-ancestry-identification%2Fdp%2F167898\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Embark Breed and Health dog DNA test</a>. The test uses 200,000 genetic markers and 100 times more genetic information than its competitors. It checks for over 350 different breed types and 170-plus genetic health conditions - and it has partnered with Cornell University College of Veterinary Medicine (the leading veterinary school in the country) and a pioneer in consumer genetics - Spencer Wells - to combine cutting-edge science and pet care. They&#39;re the people who are ecstatic to tell you they <a href=\"http://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&u=1088116&m=66364&urllink=embarkvet.com%2Fembark-discovers-why-dogs-have-blue-eyes%2Fblue-eyes%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored\">recently discovered why some dogs have blue eyes</a>.</p><p>Knowing your dog&#39;s genetic history is great for the shallow interest of curiosity and dog park small talk, but it can also help you navigate potential health risks, avoid medications they could be sensitive to, and even help you decide how big of a home you&#39;re going to need in the future.</p><h2><strong>Here&#39;s how the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Fembark-breed-ancestry-identification%2Fdp%2F167898\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">dog DNA test</a> works</strong></h2><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Fembark-breed-ancestry-identification%2Fdp%2F167898\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Order the test online</a>, activate it, swab the cheek of your dog, and mail the sample back to the Embark lab in a pre-paid return envelope. In two to four weeks, you&#39;ll receive the results. If you&#39;re unsure how to swab your dog&#39;s cheek correctly, <a href=\"http://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&u=1088116&m=66364&urllink=embarkvet.com%2Fhow-to-swab-your-dog%2F-your-dog%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">there are video tutorials on the site</a>. </p><p>I tried the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Fembark-breed-ancestry-identification%2Fdp%2F167898\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Embark dog DNA test</a> on our rescue dog, Nellie, to see how it worked in real life. If you keep scrolling down to the bottom of this article, you can see the exact steps we went through in greater detail. But what I liked best was how digestible the information was for non-scientists, and how many resources were provided if you&#39;d like to do further research. I also loved how obviously passionate about dogs the Embark team seemed to be.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Fembark-breed-ancestry-identification%2Fdp%2F167898\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bec90330591f2136f6691e7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_90D34F84A0DE 1\" height=\"905\" width=\"1207\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><p>On the site, you can engage as little or as much as you want. It was as succinct as &#34;she&#39;s mostly a German Shepherd&#34; and &#34;she&#39;s clear of all the health risks we check for&#34; and as granular as links to learn how the process is done and breakdowns of what each genetic condition is as well as which breeds it&#39;s commonly found in. There are even linked citations in some sections where research was referred to. </p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chewy.com%2Fembark-breed-ancestry-identification%2Fdp%2F167898\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Embark dog DNA</a> test is not cheap, but it&#39;s information that could improve or extend the life of your dog - and for most owners, that&#39;s not a bad price to pay. </p><p>All in all, it&#39;s a great tool - and something most dog owners will probably be excited to learn about. Pets are the slobbery, warm-bodied, loving beings that occasionally care more for you than they do for themselves. Figuring out a bit more about how to responsibly return that love and care is an exciting new opportunity. </p><p>If you have multiple dogs and get tests for them, you can &#34;add a dog&#34; to your &#34;my dogs&#34; section in your account to keep your family all in one place.</p><h2>Keep reading to see our experience and our dog&#39;s results below. </h2>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tEmbark's main point of interest is probably the breed breakdown. You'll see breeds and percentages, as well as other fun tools at the top.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bec7e58e4218a7e72478344?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2018 11 14 at 2.52.56 PM\" height=\"757\" width=\"1009\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mara Leighton/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Embark breaks down dog breeds by percentages. If you keep scrolling, Embark highlights the main characteristics of each breed present.&#160;</p>\n\tEmbark tests your pup for over 170 genetic health conditions and 20 traits.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bec7d00b73c287e77703c50?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2018 11 14 at 2.41.33 PM\" height=\"754\" width=\"1005\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mara Leighton/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>We took the Embark DNA test probably just as much for the health results as to satisfy our curiosity, if not more so. Embark screens for over 170 genetic conditions looking for the mutations that can cause them, and Nellie showed up negative for everything. Being able to rule out these mutations also makes it easier for your chosen vet to determine what's wrong quickly and accurately if your dog becomes sick in the future, and to avoid prescribing medications your dog may be sensitive to. To easily share with your vet, click \"Vet Report\" to input your vet's name and email address. They'll get a copy.</p><p>Embark makes the results easy for non-scientists to understand. It showed that she was cleared for the 135 genetic conditions common for Nellie's breed (which the test already provided for us and the lab) and then broke down what those conditions are exactly. You can also view the full disease test in more detail if you wish.&#160;</p>\n\tEmbark also breaks your dog's DNA down to make a family tree that goes back to great-grandparents.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bec7ffae4218a7ec0013e55?format=jpeg\" alt=\"embark vet\" height=\"793\" width=\"1048\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mara Leighton/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Embark's algorithm generates the most likely family tree for your pup, though it's not the only possible one for your dog's mix.&#160;</p><p>You can also check out other dogs who have Embark accounts that have similar breed mixes for comparison via the Mix Matches tool.&#160;</p>\n\tThe DNA test also tests your dog's traits, making it possible to predict coat color, coat traits (shedding, curly, straight) and body size among other things.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bec810db73c287f0e427215?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2018 11 14 at 3.07.32 PM\" height=\"921\" width=\"1228\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mara Leighton/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>You'll be able to see the genes that make your dog's coat the color, texture, and shedding-heavy mess that it is, as well as your dog's projected body size, along with links to deeper wells of information if you're interested in learning more.&#160;</p><p>You can also see your dog's genetic diversity&#160;(was there inbreeding?) as well as performance. For instance, we discovered that Nellie has an adaptation that makes her more tolerant of high altitudes.&#160;</p>\n\tStaff veterinarians and customer service reps are also available to answer questions from owners.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e1c97dfb2e66a57104fb822?format=jpeg\" alt=\"embark facebook\" height=\"525\" width=\"700\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Embark Facebook</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The service also encourages users to email research@embarkvet.com if they have a particular health issue or area they're interested in.&#160;</p>\n\tYou can also take \"Health and Wellness\" quizzes to get personalized feedback and contribute to research, making the Embark test even more accurate and extensive for you and others in the future.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bec833dbeb6707e4a198c1f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2018 11 14 at 3.17.35 PM\" height=\"892\" width=\"1189\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mara Leighton/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>These quizzes and feedback mean the service can get smarter and better over time &#8212; benefiting both old users and new with more features and ever-more accurate results, just like human DNA tests. If you choose to participate, you could help scientists make new discoveries.&#160;</p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"5e1c9a3624fe124fdf592585\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Breed + Health Kit (button)</bi-shortcode>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 03-46-00-486_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=7lw7-ClQojw:mFAPnFWP3GQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn11@2020_4/2021/04/10/03-45-54-735_6c41dbe62d7884a9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/7lw7-ClQojw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn64@2020_3/2021/04/10/03-46-03-428_04c48c1ccbfdfe77.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1618026331900},{"createdTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","updatedTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","title":"Bernie Sanders expresses 'serious concerns' over Biden proposal for modest increase in Pentagon spending","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/bernie-sanders-expresses-serious-concerns-over-pentagon-spending-2021-4","description":"<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6070cc4ea451820019b3a669?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages 1208705094\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   Sen. Bernie Sanders said he has \"serious concerns\" about the Biden administration's defense spending proposal. \n   <p class=\"copyright\">Win McNamee/Getty Images</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\"> \n <li>The Biden administration is asking Congress for $753 billion to fund US military operations.</li> \n <li>That's a slight uptick over last year.</li> \n <li>Sen. Bernie Sanders said he has \"serious concerns\" about spending money on a \"bloated Pentagon.\"</li> \n <li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider's business page</a>.</li> \n</ul>\n<p>The Biden administration is requesting $753 billion in spending on the US military in its first, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bidens-budget-priorities-congress-democrats-next-year-to-go-2021-4\">$1.5 trillion budget blueprint</a>, disappointing progressives and prompting \"serious concerns\" from the chairman of the Senate committee that will ultimately decide just how much to appropriate.</p>\n<p>In a proposal released Friday, the White House requested a 1.7% increase in national security spending, including $715 billion for the Department of Defense. Accounting for inflation, that is roughly the same amount that Congress approved in 2020.</p>\n<p>But liberal Democrats had been hoping for more. Last year, members of the Congressional Progressive Caucus pushed for a 10% cut in defense spending, arguing that the money - over half of US discretionary spending - could be put to better use funding social programs, especially amid a pandemic.</p>\n<h2>'A budget is about priorities'</h2>\n<p>Sen. Bernie Sanders said the request bothered him.</p>\n<p>\"I have serious concerns,\" Sanders, an independent from Vermont who chairs the Senate Budget Committee, said in a statement Friday. \"At a time when the US already spends more on the military than the next 12 nations combined, it is time for us to take a serious look at the massive cost over-runs, the waste and fraud that currently exists in the Pentagon.\"</p>\n<p>That concern was echoed by Sanders' liberal colleague, Massachusetts Democrat Elizabeth Warren, at a Senate Armed Services Committee hearing in February.</p>\n<p>\"A budget is about priorities, and we continue to overinvest in defense while underinvesting in public health and so much more that would keep us safe and that would save lives,\" Warren said.</p>\n<p>That comment came <a href=\"https://www.warren.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/deputy-secretary-of-defense-nominee-dr-kathleen-hicks-agrees-with-senator-warren-that-we-could-lower-our-740-billion-defense-budget-to-better-reflect-our-priorities-without-sacrificing-our-security\">during questioning</a> of Dr. Kathleen Hicks, the Biden administration's pick for deputy secretary of defense. Hicks, for her part, said the Pentagon could get by on less money, but that would require \"hard choices\" the White House does not appear willing to tackle in its first spending proposal.</p>\n<p>In 2020, the Pentagon failed its audit for the third year in a row. It does not expect to pass a comprehensive review of its assets until at least 2027.</p>\n<h2>Biden administration defends proposal</h2>\n<p>A White House official, speaking on background with reporters on Friday, sought to assuage progressive critics.</p>\n<p>\"A large chunk of that increase is to pay for the pay raise for men and women in uniform and the civilians that support them,\" they said.</p>\n<p>According to the federal formula for military pay increases, service members should expect a 2.7% increase in their salary, the Military Times <a href=\"https://www.militarytimes.com/news/pentagon-congress/2020/12/26/new-in-2021-military-pay-raise-likely-to-be-smaller-next-year/\">reported last December</a>.</p>\n<p>The Biden administration will release a more detailed spending proposal in the coming months.</p>\n<p><em>Have a news tip? Email this reporter: <a href=\"mailto:cdavis@insider.com\">cdavis@insider.com</a></em></p>\n<div class=\"read-original\">\n Read the original article on \n <a border=\"0\" /></a> \n</div>\n<img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/s9u2SCHpJdY\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\" />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 09 Apr 2021 22:24:15 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/6070cc59a451820019b3a66a?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"6ce615679b6f9dbc9b89c3dce10889db","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn56@2020_4/2021/04/10/03-45-53-508_90820ad69f3cf50d.webp","destWidth":2223,"destHeight":1666,"sourceBytes":97968,"destBytes":97968,"author":"cdavis@insider.com (Charles Davis)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/6070cc4ea451820019b3a669?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn87@2020_2/2021/04/10/03-46-03-666_9f7205297f69cafe.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn43@2020_5/2021/04/10/03-46-06-040_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=s9u2SCHpJdY:1PPkvRReiCU:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn51@2020_5/2021/04/10/03-45-57-950_e7a9ae7e2d040a67.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=s9u2SCHpJdY:1PPkvRReiCU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn36@2020_4/2021/04/10/03-45-54-610_711f6eccb97f931d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn75@2020_6/2021/04/10/03-46-00-486_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=s9u2SCHpJdY:1PPkvRReiCU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn52@2020_6/2021/04/10/03-46-33-865_33979bb10f4ae267.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/s9u2SCHpJdY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn26@2020_2/2021/04/10/03-46-10-986_226619cba83205e0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1618026331706},{"createdTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","updatedTime":"2021-04-10 11:45:31","title":"No, a US Air Force fighter pilot wasn't photographed wearing a 'Russian patch'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/air-force-fighter-pilot-wasnt-photographed-wearing-a-russian-patch-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6070a1c1a451820019b3a57c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Air Force F-15 Lakenheath\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The 493rd Fighter Squadron &#34;King Jet&#34; takes off during exercise Point Blank 21-2 at Royal Air Force Lakenheath, April 7, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">US Air Force/Airman 1st Class Jessi Monte</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A photo of an F-15E pilot with a &#34;Russian patch&#34; was posted by the RAF Lakenheath&#39;s Facebook page.</li>\n<li>The post was about Exercise Point Blank currently in progress in the UK, but many people fixated on the patch, believing it to be the &#34;enemy&#39;s insignias.&#34;</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The US Air Force 48th Fighter Wing posted on its official Facebook page an interesting photo, showing an F-15 pilot wearing what many have called a &#34;Russian Air Force patch&#34; on the flight suit.</p><p>The photo is part of a post about the <a href=\"https://theaviationist.com/2018/11/30/raf-f-35b-u-s-air-force-f-15e-and-french-air-force-rafale-jets-together-for-the-first-time-during-exercise-point-blank/\">Exercise Point Blank</a> currently in progress in the UK, a recurring large force exercise designed and cohosted by the Royal Air Force and the 48th Fighter Wing.</p><p>Many reacted strongly to the photos, even calling the pilot &#34;a traitor&#34; because he was wearing &#34;enemy&#39;s insignias.&#34;</p><p>Upon a closer look, though, the patch was found to be only a patch used by the F-15E Strike Eagle pilots of the <a href=\"https://theaviationist.com/2021/03/16/492nd-fs-deployment-video-shows-f-15e-strike-eagle-flying-low-over-strategic-u-s-military-outpost-in-syria/\">492nd Fighter Squadron &#34;Bolars&#34;</a> when flying as the Aggressors in the Red Air role during complex training missions like the ones of Exercise Point Blank.</p><p>The shield-shaped patch shows a Russian-made <a href=\"https://theaviationist.com/2020/05/29/watch-a-russian-su-27-flanker-intercept-a-u-s-b-1b-bomber-flying-over-the-black-sea-earlier-today/\">Su-27 Flanker</a> on a blue background with a Russian flag and the Cyrillic writing &#34;Russia&#34; on the top and the number &#34;492&#34; on the bottom, closely resembling the insignia of the now deactivated 611th Fighter Aviation Regiment of the Russian Aerospace Forces.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6070a1b0a451820019b3a57b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Air Force F-15 pilot aggressor\" height=\"1346\" width=\"1682\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A 492nd Fighter Squadron pilot conducts pre-flight checks during exercise Point Blank 21-2 at RAF Lakenheath, April 7, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">US Air Force/Airman 1st Class Jessi Monte</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>We did some further research about this patch and it looks like it has been around for at least three years, as some copies of the patch (including some early variants which were corrected before the final version) were found in auctions on Ebay and a couple of other websites in 2018.</p><p>The auctions&#39; descriptions stated: &#34;492nd FS &#39;Red Air&#39; Flanker Aggressor patch. The term &#39;Red Air&#39; is used to describe the opposing fighter in air-to-air combat training. This patch is worn by aircrew flying the aircraft while using adversary tactics.&#34;</p><p>Others say it&#39;s an &#34;Air Policing&#34; patch. Whatever, it&#39;s certainly not a Russian patch.</p><p>It is not uncommon for pilots <a href=\"https://theaviationist.com/2019/10/30/57th-fighter-wing-at-nellis-afb-completes-new-wraith-aggressor-f-16/\">who fly the enemy&#39;s role</a> during training exercises to wear patches and helmet covers inspired by the insignias of the adversaries that they are simulating, it is almost &#34;a tradition&#34; that is found not only in the United States, but also in the rest of the world.</p><p>Some specialized units even replicate the adversaries&#39; insignias and liveries on their aircraft, like the <a href=\"https://theaviationist.com/2019/10/30/57th-fighter-wing-at-nellis-afb-completes-new-wraith-aggressor-f-16/\">Aggressor squadrons</a> of the US Air Force and <a href=\"https://theaviationist.com/2020/07/20/u-s-navy-f-5f-performs-first-flight-in-su-27-flanker-inspired-siberian-tiger-paint-scheme/\">Navy</a>. This is not done to mock the adversary which inspired the Aggressor pilots, but to help the visual identification during training.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/air-force-fighter-pilot-wasnt-photographed-wearing-a-russian-patch-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=SLf2qb46DH8:IB9RcK-kKGc:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a
